Title: Data Analyst (B2C) (m/f/d)
Description:
Company Description

Omio’s vision is to enable people to travel seamlessly anywhere, anyway. We are bringing all global transport into a single distribution system and creating end-to-end magical consumer journeys.

With Omio you can compare and book trains, buses, ferries and flights anywhere in Europe, the US, and Canada with one simple search, on mobile, app or desktop. By offering transparent pricing and easy booking, Omio makes travel planning simple, flexible and personal.

Omio is the largest source of inventory, with 1000+ suppliers operating in 39 countries. Our brands also include Rome2Rio for global discovery, while Omio powers ticketing and journeys, which attract 900m+ users every year. Our offices are based in Berlin, Prague, Melbourne, Brazil, Bangalore, and London.

We are a growing team of more than 400 passionate employees from more than 50 countries who share the same vision: to create a single tool to help send travellers almost anywhere in the world.

Job Description

Omio is rapidly expanding its product offerings across all of its markets and is looking to grow its capabilities and improve the efficiency of how we enable use of data to drive fast, accurate decision making across the business.

We are working through a major change programme designed to evolve the use of data across the organisation, focussing on quality and accessibility, and taking a product-led approach.

Our B2C business is the backbone of our success. We are looking for a Data Analyst to support our business operations by delivering consistent, accurate measurement of performance across all domains, from regular management reporting and deep dives, through finance and fraud reporting, to ad-hoc insights for e.g. PR and Communications purposes.

Key Responsibilities


Understand Omio’s business model, particularly around the supply of travel inventory across the globe.
Understand and lead on establishing Omio’s top-line metrics and KPIs, reporting their evolution, detecting anomalies, evaluating key drivers, and diagnosing issue root causes.
Build dashboards to support efficient dissemination of the above trends
Build forecasting models to understand gaps in current performance and sales/revenue optimization models to enhance margins without negatively impacting user experience
Perform statistical analyses - including A/B tests and pre/post analyses
Correlate marketing/product/commercial data to derive key insights
Work with our data engineering/business intelligence teams to build data models, which best summarise and utilise our production data
Act as an advocate of our company’s data-driven culture: produce reports that are actionable, dashboards that are diagnostic, and recommendations that drive growth


Qualifications

A successful candidate will be:


Passionate about continuous improvement.
An excellent stakeholder manager with great communication and presentation skills.
Enthusiastic, with a sense of pride in the work delivered and the quality of how it was delivered.
An open and honest individual who both welcomes and provides feedback in a way that is constructive and thoughtful.
Highly collaborative with fantastic facilitation skills at team and department level.
Comfortable with flexibility, ambiguity and changing priorities.
Value and outcome-driven, with a positive “can-do” attitude.


A Successful Candidate Will Have


Minimum 3 years of experience as a product or data analyst, ideally in the tech start-up/scale-up environment.
Strong analytical thinking with a structured approach to problem-solving.
Experienced in using SQL extensively
Strong communication skills and a proven track record of collaborating effectively within cross-functional teams
Strong business intuition and a data-driven mindset to drive impactful solutions that meet strategic objectives. Communicate complex insights clearly and collaborate seamlessly with senior management to support decision-making
Bonus points if you have:
Knowledge of Looker development
Basic knowledge of Python

Additional Information

What’s in it for you?


Have an impact. With innovation and smart technology, we are changing the way people travel, and you too can have an impact on this ride
A competitive and attractive compensation package
Subsidized Urban Sports Club membership
A diverse team of more than 45 nationalities


Diversity makes us stronger

We value diversity and welcome all applicants regardless of ethnicity, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age or disability.

Hiring process and background checks

At Omio, we work in partnership with Giant Screening, once a job offer has been accepted, Giant will be engaged to carry out background screening. Giant will reach out to you via email and occasionally via telephone/text message so that they can gather all the relevant information required. Consent will be requested prior to any information being passed to our services company.

Recruitment scams: Important notice

Protect yourself from scammers, Omio wants to ensure your ongoing safety during the application process at Omio. Please keep in mind potential scammers impersonating Omio recruiters (mainly via a global professional networking site, and messenger app's).

Remember, Omio never requests payment or sensitive personal information during the recruitment process. All official job opportunities are exclusively posted on our careers page. If you suspect fraudulent activity, report it to recruitment@omio.com. Remember to cross-reference against our careers page if you question the authenticity, stay vigilant, and protect yourself from recruitment scams.

Intrigued? Apply here in English.

Title: Social Insight Analyst
Description:
Your Tasks


Translate social media conversations and digital trends into clear, actionable insights for key stakeholders across the company
Monitor, analyze, and interpret social media and listening data using platforms like Netbase Quid or similar tools; turn findings into compelling reports and dashboards
Identify emerging trends, audience behaviors, and content patterns to support campaign development and innovation
Collaborate closely with marketing, PR, and sales teams to deliver timely and relevant social insights for both ongoing and upcoming initiatives
Contribute to pitches and client presentations with clear, data-driven storytelling
Continuously evaluate and test new social listening and analytics tools to enhance our insight capabilities
Stay on top of developments in the creator economy and influencer marketing landscape to help shape internal strategies


Your Profile


University degree in Marketing, Data Analytics, Business Administration, or a related field
Minimum of 3 years of professional experience in market research, data analysis, and social media marketing
Proven analytical skills with hands-on experience in data visualization and interpretation using tools such as Power BI or Tableau
Familiarity with programming languages such as Python or R, or a strong willingness to deepen technical skills in this area
Advanced proficiency in social media tracking and listening tools such as Meltwater, Netbase Quid, or comparable platforms
Solid understanding of Generative AI tools and their application in analytics and content strategy
In-depth knowledge of the creator economy and a strong grasp of current social media trends and platform dynamics
Full professional fluency in both German and English, spoken and written
High level of adaptability and drive, with the ability to manage multiple projects in a fast-paced, agile work environment


About Us

We Are Era is the first pan-European studio and talent agency with offices in Amsterdam, Berlin, Cologne, Copenhagen, Paris, Milan and Stockholm. Our vision? Shaping the zeitgeist in an era of movements - and with success: our productions and campaigns for broadcasters, brands and NGOs have won multiple awards. We create stories with impact and attitude, developed and told by and for people all over Europe. Our projects range from TV productions and fictional series to innovative formats on social video platforms such as YouTube, Instagram, Twitch and TikTok. We develop social influencers and artists into cross-platform personality brands that are now found on social media, on TV, in podcasts, on the big screen or in the music charts. Our international team of 250 speaks all languages - from mainstream to subculture, from the Friday For Future movement to K-pop culture. Together, we offer our partners the fast-lane ticket to every community in Europe. Are you ready to shape the zeitgeist with us? Join the Movement!

Title: (Senior) Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Everything we do, starts with you. Together with you, we build the most human-centric fintech. To enable everyone’s future financial growth.




We are looking for a Data Analyst (m/f/d)

(unlimited, full-time) Join our team at our location in Berlin, Verl, Baden-Baden, Oslo or Stockholm – hybrid working conditions available.




Key Responsibilities:

Explore large datasets, evaluate the data quality and model data
Apply statistical methods to understand consumer behavioral patterns relevant for product development and operational efficiency
Analyze problems to understand their root cause
Work with Data Scientists and Data Engineers to build and implement analytical solutions
Collaborate on data-related projects
Visualize data and turn data into stories
Derive actionable insights, provide decision support, and make recommendations based on data-driven insights
Consult business units and functional units, such as product or commercial teams in data related questions
Drive, manage and lead data related projects while fostering a culture of data-driven decision-making across the organization.




Your Profile:

Master/MBA degree in numerate subject (e.g. Data Science, Mathematics, Informatics, Economics, Natural Science or Engineering)
3+ years of hands-on experience in data analysis roles within Data & Analytics solutions
Proficient in a programming language such as SQL, Python or R
Experience in cluster analysis, machine learning
Understanding of how to perform data extraction and manipulation
Advanced in collecting, organizing, analysing, and disseminating significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Ability to identify issues, structure and conduct necessary analysis, and draw well-informed conclusions
Consulting skills, especially strong ability to provide insights and recommendations
Extraordinary communication skills to effectively convey complex information and collaborate with diverse teams
Ability to balance multiple priorities, be detail-oriented, work independently, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment
Excellent Team player




Nice if you have:

Experience within the payments, risk, debt collection or factoring space
Experience with modern data stacks, preferably Databricks
Experience in quantitative research

#EUR33




Thrive at Riverty with great benefits:

Immerse yourself in a welcoming, trust-filled atmosphere as part of our agile teams and explore the fantastic opportunities within the Bertelsmann Group.
Put your health first by engaging in a variety of supported sports and leisure activities – it's important to us!
Empower your growth and professional development with Riverty’s training sessions and customized development plans. Together, we'll learn, evolve, and achieve success.
Know that you're appreciated with plenty of employee benefits & discounts just for you.
Experience the best of both worlds with our flexible working arrangements, which let you mix on-site teamwork and remote work to create the perfect professional experience that suits your life.

Please note, benefits could be different depending on location or agreement details, and they may alter over time. We'd be delighted to explore these benefits in greater depth during an interview.




About Us

We are Riverty. And we believe everyone should be in control of their financials. We ask you to join in. Because together with you, we build the most human-centric fintech. We build on experience of more than 50 years. More than 5,000 people in 13 countries drive our company and contribution to society. And we have their backs. We make sure they feel supported and included: Across teams, across physical and invisible borders and across the globe.

Our world is growing. And we’re here. Together, we’re finding smarter, simpler, seamlessly connected ways to manage money. By leveraging data and financial technology, our holistic solutions provide flexible payments, smarter accounting, and fair debt collection, all aimed at fostering everyone's financial growth.

And. Everything we do, starts with you. Join us and let‘s build a more sustainable financial future, together.




We keep what we promise:

More information on riverty.com/careers. Are you already convinced? Then we look forward to receiving your online application – with just a few clicks.

We look forward to applications from candidates who contribute to the diversity of our company. We relate diversity in particular to the dimensions of cultural or social origin, religion, age, disability, gender and sexual identity.

Title: Data & Analytics Consulting - Analyst (m/d/f)
Description:
Who We Are




Oliver Wyman is a global management consultancy working across all areas of industry, financial services, government, and non-profit organizations. Clients approach us with their most significant challenges, and we assemble teams of experts to address each facet of these complex issues. Together, we create breakthroughs that lead to remarkable impact.

Within Oliver Wyman, the Data and Analytics (DNA) division was established in 2017 and is operating across the entire world, with a focus on Europe. We are a dynamic and rapidly growing team of quantitative analytics specialists, collaborating closely with colleagues across the firm to cover a global footprint, working across multiple industries including, but not limited to, Financial Services, Climate & Sustainability, Energy, Retail, and Transportation.

We believe in the power of diverse perspectives and collaborative teams to drive innovation. Our team comes from a wide range of backgrounds and experiences, and we embrace the unique skills and insights they bring to our work. At Oliver Wyman and within DNA, we are proud of the values we uphold that guide us every day in how we work and collaborate. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive and reach their full potential.




What You Will Do




As a member of Oliver Wyman’s Data & Analytics team, you will collaborate with colleagues and clients at all levels from your very first day, helping clients solve their most pressing challenges. Our DNA team is committed to developing tailored solutions for clients around the globe, including designing potential solutions for analytical challenges, implementing various prototypes while also assessing their effectiveness, and engaging in discussions with clients and colleagues to share ideas. Your contributions will be invaluable to delivering impactful results for our clients.

Notable projects include:

Developing an NLP-based machine learning toolkit to predict credit rating downgrades using news articles – click here for more information
Modelling portfolio decarbonization strategies leveraging advanced analytics techniques for large European banks
Optimizing and developing a promotional program using data from historical promotions for an Asian health & beauty chain by deploying a promotion analytics toolkit
Validating a customer-facing GenAI chatbot for an American bank
Developing probability of default and loss models in Python for European and UK-based banks
Identifying supply chain risks by combining multiple live data feeds, and developing and applying a bespoke AI based risk methodology – click here for more information
Developing a next best action model to reduce customer churn for a global telecom company




Why Join Us?




Expect a steep learning curve, as no two projects are ever the same. You’ll have the opportunity to travel internationally, gaining invaluable experiences and insights across different cultures and with access to the latest technologies, you’ll constantly expand your toolkit with each new endeavor.

You won’t be alone on this journey; various colleagues will guide and coach you throughout your career. You’ll have a dedicated buddy, a career adviser, and a talent manager to help you navigate your professional path. We also care deeply about sustainable work-life quality, providing you with the flexibility to balance your career aspirations with your personal life.

This role will empower you to embrace your curiosity and step out of your comfort zone. You will have the opportunity to work alongside genuine colleagues who measure success by the lasting impact we create together. If you’re excited by challenges and eager to make a meaningful impact, we look forward to welcoming you aboard!




Who Can Apply?




Bachelor's, Master’s, or PhD in a quantitative discipline from a top academic program (Data Science, Mathematics, Natural Sciences, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
Data-driven mindset and proficiency with numbers, paired with the ability to explain sophisticated data science concepts in an understandable manner to clients and colleagues
Ideally, programming skills in Python or R, but more importantly, an eagerness to continuously extend your knowledge of technologies
Strong commitment to teamwork and resilience in a creative and constantly changing environment
Excellent command of German & English (verbal and written)
Interest and experience in financial services and risk management is a plus




How to Apply?




To ensure that we can proceed with your application, we kindly ask you to submit your CV together with all of your academic and practical transcripts. This includes your high school diploma, your Bachelor's (and, if applicable, your Master's) transcripts, along with references from your previous work experiences.

Please be aware that applications with incomplete documents will not be eligible for further consideration in the application process.

If you would like to find out more information about Oliver Wyman, please visit our website or alternatively, apply to attend one of our events, details of which can be found here.

Oliver Wyman is an equal opportunity employer and a wholly owned subsidiary of Marsh & McLennan Companies. To learn more, please follow us on LinkedIn, Instagram or Twitter. Marsh & McLennan Companies and its Affiliates are EOE Minority/Female/Disability/Vet/Sexual Orientation/ Gender Identity employers.




What to expect during the interviews process?




At Oliver Wyman, we want you to shine in your interview. Our process is designed like our work environment — it’s challenging, exciting, and fun.

With a mix of conversational and case interviews, our approach not only helps us to get to know you better, understanding your strengths and interests, but it also enables you to learn more about our people and our business.

If you want to learn more about consulting interviews and start your preparation, please visit our careers page: https://www.oliverwyman.com/careers/entry-level/interview-preparation.html




Oliver Wyman, a business of Marsh McLennan (NYSE: MMC), is a management consulting firm combining deep industry knowledge with specialized expertise to help clients optimize their business, improve operations and accelerate performance. Marsh McLennan is a global leader in risk, strategy and people, advising clients in 130 countries across four businesses: Marsh, Guy Carpenter, Mercer and Oliver Wyman. With annual revenue of $24 billion and more than 90,000 colleagues, Marsh McLennan helps build the confidence to thrive through the power of perspective. For more information, visit oliverwyman.com, or follow on LinkedIn and X.




Marsh McLennan is committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and flexible work environment. We aim to attract and retain the best people and embrace diversity of age, background, disability, ethnic origin, family duties, gender orientation or expression, marital status, nationality, parental status, personal or social status, political affiliation, race, religion and beliefs, sex/gender, sexual orientation or expression, skin color, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.




Marsh McLennan is committed to hybrid work, which includes the flexibility of working remotely and the collaboration, connections and professional development benefits of working together in the office. All Marsh McLennan colleagues are expected to be in their local office or working onsite with clients at least three days per week. Office-based teams will identify at least one “anchor day” per week on which their full team will be together in person.

  • Interest and experience in financial services and risk management is a plus


How to Apply?


To ensure that we can proceed with your application, we kindly ask you to submit your CV together with all of your academic and practical transcripts. This includes your high school diploma, your Bachelor's (and, if applicable, your Master's) transcripts, along with references from your previous work experiences.

Please be aware that applications with incomplete documents will not be eligible for further consideration in the application process.

If you would like to find out more information about Oliver Wyman, please visit our website or alternatively, apply to attend one of our events, details of which can be found here.

Oliver Wyman is an equal opportunity employer and a wholly owned subsidiary of Marsh & McLennan Companies. To learn more, please follow us on LinkedIn, Instagram or Twitter. Marsh & McLennan Companies and its Affiliates are EOE Minority/Female/Disability/Vet/Sexual Orientation/ Gender Identity employers.


What to expect during the interviews process?


At Oliver Wyman, we want you to shine in your interview. Our process is designed like our work environment — it’s challenging, exciting, and fun.

With a mix of conversational and case interviews, our approach not only helps us to get to know you better, understanding your strengths and interests, but it also enables you to learn more about our people and our business.

If you want to learn more about consulting interviews and start your preparation, please visit our careers page: https://www.oliverwyman.com/careers/entry-level/interview-preparation.html


Oliver Wyman, a business of Marsh McLennan (NYSE: MMC), is a management consulting firm combining deep industry knowledge with specialized expertise to help clients optimize their business, improve operations and accelerate performance. Marsh McLennan is a global leader in risk, strategy and people, advising clients in 130 countries across four businesses: Marsh, Guy Carpenter, Mercer and Oliver Wyman. With annual revenue of $24 billion and more than 90,000 colleagues, Marsh McLennan helps build the confidence to thrive through the power of perspective. For more information, visit oliverwyman.com, or follow on LinkedIn and X.


Marsh McLennan is committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and flexible work environment. We aim to attract and retain the best people and embrace diversity of age, background, disability, ethnic origin, family duties, gender orientation or expression, marital status, nationality, parental status, personal or social status, political affiliation, race, religion and beliefs, sex/gender, sexual orientation or expression, skin color, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.


Marsh McLennan is committed to hybrid work, which includes the flexibility of working remotely and the collaboration, connections and professional development benefits of working together in the office. All Marsh McLennan colleagues are expected to be in their local office or working onsite with clients at least three days per week. Office-based teams will identify at least one “anchor day” per week on which their full team will be together in person.

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
PAUL Tech AG is a technology leader in the real estate industry with the mission to make buildings carbon neutral. Our proprietary technology, consisting of IoT-enabled hardware and AI-supported software, permanently optimizes water-bearing systems in buildings. This reduces CO2 emissions and energy costs. Everyone benefits: owners, operators, occupants and the climate. At Paul, we are researchers, developers and practitioners with the common goal of developing intelligent solutions for buildings to combat climate change.

Therefore we are looking for you to drive our scaling as

Data Analyst (m/f/d) in Berlin

Core Responsibilities

Strategic Stakeholder Collaboration


Partner and collaborate closely with business stakeholders to understand their strategies, needs, and objectives



Analytical Problem Framing


Analytical outlook to frame the right questions while diving deep into business domains and processes



Data Integration and Collaboration


Connect data from various sources, collaborating with product managers and engineers to develop comprehensive data solutions



Data Model Development


Develop robust and clean data models, ensuring high-quality data thereby leading high-quality analytics



Insightful Data Communication


Communicate insights in a compelling and accessible manner to support product development and decision-making



Data-Driven Decision Support


Support the business decision-making process, by generating analytical solutions by leveraging exploratory data analysis and hypothesis based “proof of concept” framework



The Skillset We Are Looking For


Proven experience in data analysis, preferably within a business context
Strong zeal for Data crunching and wrangling
Proficiency in SQL and/or Python for data analysis and modeling
Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau
A proactive and collaborative mindset, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to articulate complex ideas
A passion for learning, hands-on work, taking ownership, and making an impact



What You Can Expect From Us


A meaningful job that contributes to global CO2 savings
A collegial working atmosphere with short decision paths
A permanent contract with an above-average salary
30 days vacation per calendar year plus 24.12. and 31.12. off
Company private health insurance and supplementary pension
Company fitness subsidy in your region
Regular company events to which you are very welcome
Tram ticket as well as drinks and fruit in our offices



Would you like to become part of us? Then apply here.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst - EU Marketing
Description:
About the team:

We are on a mission to build the ultimate go-to-market engine. To help us to achieve our mission, we are seeking a Data Analyst to strengthen the Global Analytics Team and support SumUp's strategic Marketing initiatives. This role partners with Marketing leadership to identify business needs, then construct data models, generate reports and dashboards, offer advanced analysis and actionable insights to drive improvement in our online channels. You will make a significant contribution to the business by being a valued business partner, a member of an experienced data team and by actively participating in the development of the analytics chapter.

What you'll do:


Create efficient data models that track Online Marketing funnel performance and KPIs, from ad spend to product activation.
Use data to drive analysis and actionable recommendations to shape Marketing program design, operations, and strategy
Partner with Marketing leadership and Strategic Finance to set performance targets, define KPIs, create scalable reporting and forecasts, and provide insight to drivers of pacing against goals
Collaborate closely with Senior Leadership to develop and evaluate Marketing strategies based on data-aware insights and qualitative analysis
Develop advanced dashboards to facilitate self-service analytics for the Marketing teams as well as SumUp Leadership
Drive strategic data OKRs aligned with SumUp's business goals, such as ICP analysis and readout
Partner with Analytics Engineers to ensure that data is properly collected, stored, processed, and accessible for analytics


You’ll be great for this role if you have:


A good understanding of marketing data flows, processes and industry level analytical practices (attribution models, cohorts)
Experienced in an analytical role at a high-growth tech company, including at least 1 year of hands-on experience with data analytics, data model design, dbt, and collaborative development using Git
Hands-on experience in developing advanced dashboards following industry best practices, preferably using Tableau
The ability to analyze Online Marketing and GTM needs and turn them into KPIs, insights, data models, and dashboards
Strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills, with the ability to identify trends and key insights from unclear data.
Excellent communication skills and a strategic mindset to effectively collaborate with leadership
Strong analytical skills, with the ability to apply quantitative analysis and logical reasoning to inform and influence business decisions


Why you should join SumUp:

🌍 Opportunity to work with SumUppers globally on large-scale fintech products used by millions of businesses worldwide, from our Berlin office. This involves an office-first setup.

🌈 Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion: Be part of a workplace that values and promotes diversity, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone's perspectives are respected and embraced

📚 A dedicated annual L&D budget of €2,000 for attending conferences and/or advancing your career through further education.

🚀 Enrolment onto our VSOP program: You will own a stake in SumUp’s future success

💶 A corporate pension scheme where we match up to 20% of your contributions

🔄 30 Days Sabbatical: Enjoy the unique opportunity to take a well-deserved break with our 30 days sabbatical benefit after completing 3 years of employment with SumUp.

🔗 Referral Bonus: Earn additional rewards by referring talented individuals to join the SumUp team.

🚵🏾‍♂️ Numerous other benefits such as Urban Sports Club subsidy, Kita placement assistance, relocation assistance, subsidised office lunches.

SumUp is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that proudly pursues and hires a diverse workforce. SumUp does not make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of race, colour, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age or any other basis protected by applicable laws or prohibited by Company policy. SumUp also strives for a healthy and safe workplace and strictly prohibits harassment of any kind.

About us:

SumUp is a leading financial technology company, founded in 2012 with the goal of empowering small businesses around the globe. We’re the financial partner of choice for more than 4 million merchants in over 35 markets. We collectively build, plan and fine-tune the technology that drives SumUp and empowers small businesses around the world.

We believe in the everyday hero. Those who have the courage to follow their passion and who have the strength and determination to realise their dreams. Small business owners are at the heart of all we do, so we're creating powerful, easy-to-use financial solutions to help them run their business. With a founders mentality and a 'team-first attitude' our diverse teams across Europe, South America, and the United States work together to ensure that small business owners can be successful doing what they love.

Job Application Tip

We recognise that candidates feel they need to meet 100% of the job criteria in order to apply for a job. Please note that this is only a guide. If you don’t tick every box, it’s ok too because it means you have room to learn and develop your career at SumUp.
Show more

Title: Energy Data Internship (m/w/d) - Gigafactory Berlin-Brandenburg
Description:
What To Expect
The Energy Team continuously monitors and manages the utility systems, ensuring they meet the process specifications for vehicle production. The team is also responsible for forecasting the factory’s Energy requirements, continuously designing and implementing strategies and improvements to ensure optimum energy performance of the factory, working on energy efficiency improvements.

As an intern, you will work with many interfaces within the energy team and have contact with various stakeholders within the factory. Your main task would be to establish a working dashboard which forecasts factory’s Energy usage. This dashboard will then be a major tool used by the team in making key decisions.

Start Date: ASAP

Duration: 6 months

Location: Gigafactory Berlin-Brandenburg

What You'll Do


Understanding Manufacturing processes in the factory and its effect on Energy usage
Coordinating with Manufacturing Shops to gather information that affects Energy usage
Coordinating with the Technical Service to gather information that affects Energy usage
Build a working Machine learning model based dashboard for forecasting Electricity and Gas usage for short term and long term
Establish data transfer protocol to automize data infeed into the dashboard. For Eg – automatic input for outside weather condition, automizing
Communicating with other teams to understand the internal softwares used by Tesla
Identifying and establishing a workflow to keep the dashboard always updated/maintained



What You'll Bring


Your working style is proactive, pragmatic and fast-paced
Master’s (preferred) or a bachelor’s degree in Energy Data Engineering or similar
Experience in managing and analyzing large Energy datasets and utility demand forecasting
Advanced programming skills in Python or R.
Basic knowledge of electrical engineering and thermodynamics is a plus.
Experience with data integration and validation techniques (SCADA).
Excellent communication skills.
Ability to work in a large, complex environment where you must adapt to meet company needs



, Tesla

Title: Data Analyst I - Hospitality Data Team
Description:
Hi there! Thanks for stopping by 👋

Are you actively looking for a new opportunity? Or just checking the market? Well… you might just be in the right place!

Lightspeed is rapidly growing, and we're looking for a skilled Data Analyst I to join our expanding Hospitality Data Team within the product department. As strategic data partners, this team works closely with Product Managers, Designers, and Developers to deliver actionable insights that guide product development and strategic decisions. Your contributions will directly impact product performance and play a crucial role in shaping our business strategy, helping to drive overall company growth through data-driven solutions.

What You'll Do


Collaborate with Cross-Functional Teams: Work closely with Product Managers, Developers, Designers, and other stakeholders to understand their data needs and deliver relevant insights and support, contributing to product and business strategy.
Support Data Analysis: Perform analyses such as customer segmentation, customer health analysis, and impact measurement of product development initiatives using Python and SQL.
Contribute to Data Warehouse Management: Help manage and maintain our data warehouse, ensuring data is clean, accurate, and accessible for downstream analysis, particularly in cloud environments such as BigQuery.
DynamoDB Data Extraction and Visualization: Assist in accessing DynamoDB to extract relevant data and collaborate on building real-time visualizations that drive informed business decisions.
Dashboard and Report Maintenance: Maintain dashboards using tools like Heap and BigQuery to help teams track KPIs and user behaviors. Collaborate on creating a catalog of reusable dashboards for Product and UX teams.
Segment Collaboration: Support in setting up, maintaining, and testing the Segment customer data platform, aligning it with our data strategy and objectives.
Foster a Data-Driven Culture: Contribute to fostering a data-driven culture within the team by sharing insights, promoting best practices, and assisting team members with data analysis challenges.
Work in an Agile Environment: Collaborate effectively in an agile environment, working closely with cross-functional teams to meet dynamic business needs and deliver data insights in line with product development cycles.



Experience

What You'll Bring:


2-3+ years of experience in Python, with strong capabilities in data analysis and scripting.
2-3+ years of experience in SQL, with experience in BigQuery and Dataform as a plus.
Familiarity with Customer Data Platforms like Segment and analytics tools like Heap.

Technical Skills


Python Proficiency: Strong ability to script for data extraction, manipulation, and analysis (Pydantic, Scikit-learn, Poetry).
SQL Proficiency: Experience in querying and manipulating data using SQL, with a focus on cloud platforms such as BigQuery.
Data Visualization: Experience building and maintaining dashboards with tools like Heap, Looker, or Google Data Studio.
Version Control: Familiarity with Git and version control best practices.
As a Plus:
Experience working with data warehouses, particularly Dataform or similar data transformation frameworks.
Communication & Collaboration: Strong communication skills, with the ability to present data insights effectively and collaborate with different teams across the organization.
Business Acumen & Problem-Solving: Ability to translate data into actionable business insights that directly inform business strategy and product development.
Teamwork: Collaborative spirit, with the ability to contribute to shared goals within a dynamic, cross-functional, and agile environment.


What’s in it for you


Lots of autonomy, flexible work culture with the option of working remotely or from one of our beautiful offices
Genuine career growth opportunities within a company that's continuously expanding
Be part of a team large enough for growth yet agile enough for real impact
Work on high-traffic products with a global user base
Opportunity to work alongside other highly skilled engineers, learn and expand your skill set, forge wonderful relationships and make your mark within the diverse and inclusive Lightspeed culture, a true Canadian tech success story



… and enjoy a range of benefits that’ll keep you happy and healthy:


Lightspeed share scheme (we are all owners).
Flexible working policy.
Mental health online platform and counselling & coaching services.
Health and wellness benefits.
LinkedIn Learning license (learning is always ongoing).
Volunteer day to be able to give back to society!



To all recruitment agencies: Lightspeed does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. If we have not directly engaged your company in writing to supply candidates for a specific vacancy, Lightspeed will not be responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Lightspeed is a proud equal opportunity employer and we are committed to creating an inclusive and barrier-free workplace. Lightspeed welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Where to from here?

Obviously, this has to be mutually beneficial: we want you to step into a role you love, and we want to offer you a place you’re proud to come to every day. For a glimpse into our world check out our career page here.

Lightspeed is building communities through commerce, and we need people from all backgrounds and lived experiences to do that. We were founded in 2005, in Montreal’s gay village and our original members were all part of the LGBTQ+ community. The ethos of our business has been about inclusion from the very beginning, and we strive to provide a workplace where everyone belongs.

Who We Are

Powering the businesses that are the backbone of the global economy, Lightspeed's one-stop commerce platform helps merchants innovate to simplify, scale, and provide exceptional customer experiences. Our cloud commerce solution transforms and unifies online and physical operations, multichannel sales, expansion to new locations, global payments, financial solutions, and connection to supplier networks.

Founded in Montréal, Canada in 2005, Lightspeed is dual-listed on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE: LSPD) and Toronto Stock Exchange (TSX: LSPD). With teams across North America, Europe, and Asia Pacific, the company serves retail, hospitality, and golf businesses in over 100 countries.

Lightspeed handles your information in accordance with our Applicant Privacy Statement.

Title: Working Student - Data Science (f/m/x)
Description:
Company Description

We are seeking a technically skilled and passionate Working Student to join our dynamic Data Science department at AUTO1 Group Technology. As part of our disruptive approach in the used car market, our team leverages cutting-edge technology to develop Machine Learning solutions that optimize our platforms and processes. AUTO1 Group is Europe's leading digital automotive platform. We revolutionize the used car market with our well-known brands Autohero, wirkaufendeinauto.de, and AUTO1.com.

As a Working Student in Data Science, you will have the opportunity to work on Machine Learning model improvements and bring them into production. If this sounds exciting, read on!

Job Description


Support the development and improvement of pricing models using both traditional tabular data and deep learning approaches
Carry out data analysis and preparation for machine learning models
Help maintain and optimise existing ML models
Collaborate with the data science team as a whole
Learn and apply best practices in Machine Learning and Data Science


Qualifications


Currently enrolled in or completed university degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, or related technical field. Students from other degree programmes can also be considered if they have relevant Machine Learning project experience
Proficiency in Python and SQL for data manipulation, analysis and ML
Basic understanding of machine learning concepts, previous ML experience or projects is a plus
Good analytical and problem-solving skills and strong English communication skills


Additional Information


International teams
Personal growth with the contribution of own ideas
Exciting team events like Hackathons to foster collaboration and innovation
Join our Early Career Program, get a fair salary and experience our AUTO1 world cross-functionally through special internal events
Be part of Europe's leading digital automotive platform!


Apply by uploading your CV with a note of your earliest starting date.

Contact

Lina Antoniuk

At AUTO1 Group we live an open culture, believe in direct communication, and value diversity. We welcome every applicant; regardless of gender, ethnic origin, religion, age, sexual identity, disability, or any other non-merit factor.

HTML:
Company Description

We are seeking a technically skilled and passionate Working Student to join our dynamic Data Science department at AUTO1 Group Technology. As part of our disruptive approach in the used car market, our team leverages cutting-edge technology to develop Machine Learning solutions that optimize our platforms and processes. AUTO1 Group is Europe's leading digital automotive platform. We revolutionize the used car market with our well-known brands Autohero, wirkaufendeinauto.de, and AUTO1.com.

As a Working Student in Data Science, you will have the opportunity to work on Machine Learning model improvements and bring them into production. If this sounds exciting, read on!

Job Description

  • Support the development and improvement of pricing models using both traditional tabular data and deep learning approaches
  • Carry out data analysis and preparation for machine learning models
  • Help maintain and optimise existing ML models
  • Collaborate with the data science team as a whole
  • Learn and apply best practices in Machine Learning and Data Science

Qualifications

  • Currently enrolled in or completed university degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, or related technical field. Students from other degree programmes can also be considered if they have relevant Machine Learning project experience
  • Proficiency in Python and SQL for data manipulation, analysis and ML
  • Basic understanding of machine learning concepts, previous ML experience or projects is a plus
  • Good analytical and problem-solving skills and strong English communication skills

Additional Information

  • International teams
  • Personal growth with the contribution of own ideas
  • Exciting team events like Hackathons to foster collaboration and innovation
  • Join our Early Career Program, get a fair salary and experience our AUTO1 world cross-functionally through special internal events
  • Be part of Europe's leading digital automotive platform!

Apply by uploading your CV with a note of your earliest starting date.

Contact

Lina Antoniuk

At AUTO1 Group we live an open culture, believe in direct communication, and value diversity. We welcome every applicant; regardless of gender, ethnic origin, religion, age, sexual identity, disability, or any other non-merit factor.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
As a Business Intelligence Analyst (m/f/d) in the Global Digital Marketing & Sales Operations Team, you will be primarily responsible for generating and preparing data-driven insights for our marketing, service, and sales activities. By aggregating, analyzing, and visualizing data from various sources, you will play a key role in optimizing our customer journey, enhancing the efficiency of our marketing and lead generation campaigns, improving call center management processes, and supporting strategic decision-making.

Your impact


Conducting customer journey analyses using Global Digital Marketing data to identify trends and derive actionable recommendations.
Developing, maintaining, and optimizing dashboards and reports in Power BI and Google Sheets for KPI visualization and monitoring.
Automating and optimizing data processes while ensuring data quality using Python, SQL, and Databricks.
Supporting central and global marketing teams with planning, forecasting, and ongoing monitoring of their target KPIs.
Creating country-specific analyses to drive growth and optimize the use of digital marketing channels in individual markets.
Collaborating closely with the Data Engineering and Data Science teams within Viessmann IT.
Preparing results in the form of presentations, reports, and summaries for relevant stakeholders.


Who You Are


A completed degree in business administration, economics, data science, or a comparable analytical field.
Several years of professional experience in business intelligence, data analytics, CRM, or a similar analytical area.
Strong analytical skills and knowledge of statistics and data modeling.
Extensive experience with tools like Power BI, Google Data Studio, Databricks, and ideally Python, SQL, or similar technologies.
Experience in analyzing CRM, call center, and/or performance marketing data.
Ability to effectively prepare and present complex data in an understandable and impactful way.
Independent, structured working style and enjoyment of working in an international, cross-functional team.
Language skills in German and English (at least Level B2).


Even if you don't fulfill all of the above but are ready to take this challenge on as a next step, go ahead and press “Apply” anyway. We love your spirit!

What Makes Us Special

Our employees are the key to make our vision come alive. With that in mind, we‘ve created a range of perks for our employees:


A permanent position awaits you at our business where new technologies meet a modern workplace culture.
Viessmann Climate Solutions offers 30 days of paid vacation a year.
Once you join Viessmann, you can refer other great candidates and receive a referral bonus if they are hired.
Enjoy cool exclusive discounts on selected Viessmann Climate Solutions products and services.
Need a quick energy boost? Free healthy snacks and drinks are provided for you.
For a healthier community: Our health program offers easy access to coaching and therapy for our employees and their families.
Whether commuting by Job Bike or travelling by Europcar - our partnerships will protect the environment and your wallet.
The Viessmann academy and external partners offer a wide range of professional and personal training opportunities.
Whenever possible, Viessmann offers the option of mobile working and also provides the needed technical equipment.
Celebrate and have a great time with your co-workers at our individualized events, like our monthly breakfast or other team events.
Our flexible working hours allow you to balance your work and private life.
Daycare center or school closed? No problem! Your child will find toys and enough space to play-- and you have a fully equipped workplace to work in our child-parent room.


Who We Are

We are Viessmann Climate Solutions. Founded in 1917 as a heating technology manufacturer, and now part of Carrier, we are today one of the world's leading providers of efficient and systemic climate and renewable energy solutions. We cover all applications: heating, cooling, ventilation, water and air quality, energy generation, and energy storage for the residential and commercial sector.

Our integrated solution offering seamlessly connects products and systems via digital platforms and services to a holistic climate and energy solution, thus creating a safe and reliable feel-good climate for our users. All activities are driven by our company purpose, "We create living spaces for generations to come" and our employees are passionate about playing an active role in the energy transition. Join us on this exciting journey now.
Show more

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Do you think in data, recognize patterns where others only see numbers, and turn complex analyses into clear recommendations for action? Then you’ve come to the right place! We are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst who will take our data-driven decision-making to the next level with precise analyses and smart dashboards – creating real value for our company.







These tasks await you here:




Develop, maintain, and optimize Power BI dashboards and reports to support essential decision-making processes
Analyze internal and external data to identify trends, opportunities, and areas for optimization
Ensure data integrity and guarantee that all BI tools provide reliable and accurate information
Define and implement KPI-driven success metrics to evaluate the performance of our business processes
Collaborate closely with various departments (Operations, Finance, Sales, Real Estate Management) to develop and enhance data-driven solutions
Support colleagues in effectively using BI tools and foster a data-driven mindset within the company




Your profile:




A degree in Business Analytics, Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Finance, Economics, or a related field
2-5 years of experience in Business Intelligence, Data Analysis, or a similar role
Strong expertise in Power BI (DAX, data modeling, dashboard development) and Excel (pivot tables, complex formulas, data analysis tools, preferably macos)
Experience with SQL, APIs, ERP/CRM systems, ETL processes, and Data Warehousing is a plus – particularly in handling structured and unstructured data from diverse sources and integrating them into powerful BI systems
Knowledge of real estate market data and relevant KPIs is an advantage
Excellent English skills, ideally also German skills




This is what you can expect from us:




Learning Effects and Responsibility: A role with diverse tasks, a high degree of creative freedom, and ample opportunities for self-fulfillment
Teamwork & Diversity: Amazing team members you can rely on. We recognize the benefits of diverse teams and an inclusive corporate culture, which is why fostering diversity is a key part of our corporate strategy for the future
International Collaboration: Work alongside motivated colleagues in growing international teams
Personal Development: With a personalized development plan and continuous training, you’ll achieve your goals with us
Security: A permanent employment contract and a competitive salary package, including an annual bonus and regular salary adjustments
Leisure: 30 vacation days per year, plus additional special leave on December 24th and 31st
Fun and Benefits: Regular team events and workshops, as well as employee discounts
Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Our Story




At think-cell, we create powerful software solutions that help professionals be more efficient and productive. Founded in 2002 and based in Berlin, our tools integrate seamlessly with Microsoft Office to help users create presentations, charts, and diagrams with ease. Our dynamic, international team values creativity, collaboration, and technical excellence.




How your role will look like:




You collaborate with business owners to understand their objectives, strategies, and KPI requirements to translate them into data solutions and actionable insights
You design and implement business logic, data models and visualizations by using various methods and technologies such as SQL, Python and BI tools
You contribute to a valuable, robust and performant data platform by e.g. optimizing code, debugging anomalies and writing documentation




You will be great for this position if you have

At least 8 years of working experience in a Data Analytics environment, ideally in a similar business (Online / eCommerce)
Strong general knowledge of “how to work with data”, e.g. statistical methods, data preparation & visualization, transfer from data via analyses into actionable insights
Advanced data analytics experience with using e.g. Python or R and very good SQL skills
Experience in data modelling and BI-Tool experience, ideally PowerBi and understanding of data architecture concepts
Experience in working with Google Analytics / Matomo data
Experience in Git
Solid understanding of tracking concepts (frontend/backend)
Solid A/B testing experience
Strong ability to work both independent and as a part of the team
Strong communication and stakeholder management skills
Well structured, detail-oriented working style with a passion for efficient documentation
Desire to succeed as a team by creating synergies over individual success
Capable of outlining and presenting complex issues in an easy-to-understand manner
Great understanding of eCommerce businesses (products & challenges)
Very good language skills in English and optionally also in German




Our Values




As part of our team, you will embody and help shape the following principles that define us:




Forward Thinking: We embrace change and challenge the status quo.
Ownership: We take pride in our work and learn from our mistakes.
Customer First: We prioritize delivering lasting value.
Unified Team: We foster collaboration, respect, and integrity.
Strive for Excellence: We set ambitious goals and pursue quality.




Why is think-cell the right place for you?




We empower over 1.2 million users across 30,000 companies, including top consulting firms and major global enterprises. With offices in Berlin, Denver, Boston, London, Tokyo, and Dubai, we’re a diverse team of over 150 people, committed to innovation and excellence.




Think-cell is more than a job – it's a chance to be part of an innovative, inclusive team that values collaboration and growth. We encourage applicants from all backgrounds to apply. Together, we can shape the future of productivity software. We can’t wait to see what you’ll bring to the team!

Show more

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst – Central Reporting (f/m/x)
Description:
Company Description

Our goal is a solar power system on every roof, a storage unit in every house, and an e-car in every garage. How are we achieving this? Enpal makes solar easy: we rent out solar power systems, electricity storage and wallboxes at an all-inclusive rate, supplemented by a low-cost green electricity tariff, and intelligently networked into an integrated overall solution.

We are just at the beginning of our journey to becoming Europe's largest energy company. That's why we're looking for talented people to accompany us on this journey, leave their footprint and celebrate successes together with us. At Enpal, you will find a dynamic working environment as well as the space to develop yourself personally and professionally and to use your strengths effectively.

As the first green unicorn in Germany and the fastest-growing energy company in Europe (FT1000 Ranking 2022 by Financial Times & Statista), we continue to advance our mission of green energy for everyone. Be part of this success story and change the world with us!

Job Description


Strategic Partnership: Collaborate with the VP of Financial BI, VP of FP&A, and C-Suite leadership to align business intelligence strategies with financial goals. Work cross-functionally with Marketing, Sales, and Finance to deliver data-driven insights that support business growth and operational efficiency.
Project Ownership: Manage the intake and prioritization of data projects, ensuring clear goals, scope, and expected impact. Work with stakeholders to refine requirements, prioritize initiatives, and drive execution in alignment with business objectives.
End-to-End Data Solutions: Own the full lifecycle of data solutions, from scoping and MVP development to data modeling, implementation, and validation. Work closely with data engineers, analysts, and business leaders to ensure solutions are scalable and fit-for-purpose.
Data Visualization & Dashboarding: Develop effective, actionable dashboards and data products that translate complex data into clear, intuitive insights. Apply best practices in data visualization to communicate key information effectively across all levels, from operational teams to executive leadership.
Data-Driven Decision Making: Conduct ad-hoc analyses and exploratory data work to identify trends, patterns, and insights. Provide proactive recommendations that drive business performance and ensure ongoing monitoring of key metrics.
Enhancing Data Culture: Elevate analytical standards and best practices within the organization. Share knowledge, refine methodologies, and stay up to date with the latest BI, data visualization, and analytics trends.



Qualifications


5+ years of experience in business intelligence, data analytics, or a related field, with a strong understanding of customer acquisition, finance, and business performance drivers.
Technical expertise in SQL, ETL processes, and BI tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar. Our stack includes dbt, Snowflake, Streamlit, and Tableau.
Strong data visualization and dashboarding skills, with the ability to create clear, intuitive, and actionable insights from complex datasets.
Experience with Python or R for data analysis is a plus, particularly in advanced forecasting methods (e.g., econometrics, time series analysis).
Proven problem-solving skills, with experience in automating reporting workflows and leveraging data to improve decision-making.
Strong collaboration and communication skills, with the ability to engage business, analytics, and engineering teams to drive impactful solutions.
Ability to present data products and insights effectively to stakeholders at all management levels



Additional Information

At Enpal, we are proud of the diversity of our team. No decisions are made based on skin color, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or age, either during recruitment or employment. We strongly encourage women, neurodivergent people, people of color, and LGBTQ(+) people to apply. Enpal stands for a safe workplace and takes action against discrimination and harassment of any kind.
Show more

Title: Datenanalyst:in
Description:
Mach Daten zur Entscheidungsgrundlage.




DINA entwickelt Technologien für funktionale und Cybersicherheit in Maschinen. Unsere Lösungen sorgen dafür, dass industrielle Systeme zuverlässig, sicher und zukunftsfähig bleiben.

Wir setzen auf datengetriebene Entscheidungen – aber da geht noch mehr. Mit deiner Expertise als Data Analyst (w/m/x) bringst du Struktur in unsere Kundendaten, entwickelst aussagekräftige Analysen und sorgst dafür, dass Daten zum integralen Bestandteil unserer Geschäftsstrategie werden.




Wir arbeiten in einer Holokratie – das bedeutet: keine starren Hierarchien, keine langen Entscheidungswege, sondern Verantwortung von Tag eins an. Wenn du gestalten willst, statt nur zu verwalten, bist du hier richtig.







Deine Aufgaben




Customer Journey Analytics: Du analysierst die gesamte Customer Journey – von Marketing über Sales bis zu Customer Success – und leitest daraus klare Handlungsempfehlungen ab.
Dashboards & Reporting: Du entwickelst Dashboards für Umsatzprognosen, Deal-Pipelines, Marketing-Performance und Kundenzufriedenheit.
Revenue Operations (RevOps): Deine Analysen helfen dabei, Prozesse zu optimieren und datenbasierte Geschäftsentscheidungen zu treffen.
Datenintegration & Engineering: Du optimierst die Anbindung und Nutzung unserer Daten aus CRM (HubSpot) und ERP (SAP Business One).
Preis- & Rabattanalysen: Du erkennst Muster, analysierst Rabattstrukturen und hilfst, die Preisstrategie zu optimieren.
Zukunftsperspektive: Du treibst das Thema Daten in der Organisation voran und hast die Möglichkeit, unser Data-Team mit aufzubauen.







Dein Profil




Analytische Stärke & Business-Sinn – Du verstehst, welche Zahlen wirklich relevant sind und wie man sie sinnvoll nutzt.
Kommerzielles Gespür – Du erkennst, welche datenbasierten Entscheidungen direkten Einfluss auf das Geschäft haben.
Visualisierung – Du bereitest Daten so auf, dass sie sofort verständlich und einprägsam sind.
Storytelling mit Daten – Du kannst aus Zahlen eine klare, überzeugende Geschichte machen, die Entscheidungen vorantreibt.
Eigenverantwortung & Proaktivität – Du wartest nicht auf Aufgaben, sondern siehst, was getan werden muss – und setzt es um.
Erfahrung in der Datenanalyse – 3-5 Jahre Erfahrung mit SQL, idealerweise ergänzt durch Tableau, Power BI oder Looker.
Technisches Verständnis – Du kannst mit APIs umgehen und hast Grundkenntnisse in der Datenintegration.
Kommunikation auf Augenhöhe – Du kannst mit Sales, Marketing und Management sprechen – und bringst deine Analysen auf den Punkt.







Das bekommst du von uns




Täglicher Team-Lunch – Dein Mittagessen geht auf uns.
Firmenfitness – Zugang zu Gympass, Wellpass oder Urban Sports.
Weiterbildung & Coaching – Dein Budget für Schulungen & Konferenzen.
Ausstattung nach Wahl – Laptop, Monitor & Headset nach deinen Bedürfnissen.
Mehr Eigenverantwortung – Entscheidungen treffen, statt auf Vorgaben warten.
Klare Rollen & Transparenz – Jeder weiß, wer wofür verantwortlich ist.
Gestaltungsspielraum – Deine Ideen bewegen etwas – in Prozessen, Strategie & Technologie.
Interdisziplinäre Zusammenarbeit – Arbeiten in Kreisen, nicht in Abteilungen.
Betriebliche Altersvorsorge – 40 € VWL + 25 € Zuschuss von uns.
Team-Workshops & Offsites – Zweimal im Jahr gemeinsame Strategie & Weiterentwicklung.
Flexibel & agil – Deine Rolle wächst mit dir, nicht umgekehrt.




Show more
HTML:
Mach Daten zur Entscheidungsgrundlage.


DINA entwickelt Technologien für funktionale und Cybersicherheit in Maschinen. Unsere Lösungen sorgen dafür, dass industrielle Systeme zuverlässig, sicher und zukunftsfähig bleiben.

Wir setzen auf datengetriebene Entscheidungen – aber da geht noch mehr. Mit deiner Expertise als Data Analyst (w/m/x) bringst du Struktur in unsere Kundendaten, entwickelst aussagekräftige Analysen und sorgst dafür, dass Daten zum integralen Bestandteil unserer Geschäftsstrategie werden.


Wir arbeiten in einer Holokratie – das bedeutet: keine starren Hierarchien, keine langen Entscheidungswege, sondern Verantwortung von Tag eins an. Wenn du gestalten willst, statt nur zu verwalten, bist du hier richtig.



Deine Aufgaben


  • Customer Journey Analytics: Du analysierst die gesamte Customer Journey – von Marketing über Sales bis zu Customer Success – und leitest daraus klare Handlungsempfehlungen ab.
  • Dashboards & Reporting: Du entwickelst Dashboards für Umsatzprognosen, Deal-Pipelines, Marketing-Performance und Kundenzufriedenheit.
  • Revenue Operations (RevOps): Deine Analysen helfen dabei, Prozesse zu optimieren und datenbasierte Geschäftsentscheidungen zu treffen.
  • Datenintegration & Engineering: Du optimierst die Anbindung und Nutzung unserer Daten aus CRM (HubSpot) und ERP (SAP Business One).
  • Preis- & Rabattanalysen: Du erkennst Muster, analysierst Rabattstrukturen und hilfst, die Preisstrategie zu optimieren.
  • Zukunftsperspektive: Du treibst das Thema Daten in der Organisation voran und hast die Möglichkeit, unser Data-Team mit aufzubauen.



Dein Profil


  • Analytische Stärke & Business-Sinn – Du verstehst, welche Zahlen wirklich relevant sind und wie man sie sinnvoll nutzt.
  • Kommerzielles Gespür – Du erkennst, welche datenbasierten Entscheidungen direkten Einfluss auf das Geschäft haben.
  • Visualisierung – Du bereitest Daten so auf, dass sie sofort verständlich und einprägsam sind.
  • Storytelling mit Daten – Du kannst aus Zahlen eine klare, überzeugende Geschichte machen, die Entscheidungen vorantreibt.
  • Eigenverantwortung & Proaktivität – Du wartest nicht auf Aufgaben, sondern siehst, was getan werden muss – und setzt es um.
  • Erfahrung in der Datenanalyse – 3-5 Jahre Erfahrung mit SQL, idealerweise ergänzt durch Tableau, Power BI oder Looker.
  • Technisches Verständnis – Du kannst mit APIs umgehen und hast Grundkenntnisse in der Datenintegration.
  • Kommunikation auf Augenhöhe – Du kannst mit Sales, Marketing und Management sprechen – und bringst deine Analysen auf den Punkt.



Das bekommst du von uns


  • Täglicher Team-Lunch – Dein Mittagessen geht auf uns.
  • Firmenfitness – Zugang zu Gympass, Wellpass oder Urban Sports.
  • Weiterbildung & Coaching – Dein Budget für Schulungen & Konferenzen.
  • Ausstattung nach Wahl – Laptop, Monitor & Headset nach deinen Bedürfnissen.
  • Mehr Eigenverantwortung – Entscheidungen treffen, statt auf Vorgaben warten.
  • Klare Rollen & Transparenz – Jeder weiß, wer wofür verantwortlich ist.
  • Gestaltungsspielraum – Deine Ideen bewegen etwas – in Prozessen, Strategie & Technologie.
  • Interdisziplinäre Zusammenarbeit – Arbeiten in Kreisen, nicht in Abteilungen.
  • Betriebliche Altersvorsorge – 40 € VWL + 25 € Zuschuss von uns.
  • Team-Workshops & Offsites – Zweimal im Jahr gemeinsame Strategie & Weiterentwicklung.
  • Flexibel & agil – Deine Rolle wächst mit dir, nicht umgekehrt.

Title: Data & AI Strategist (f/m/d)
Description:
The role sits at the intersection of IT, business and innovation, developing data & AI strategies within Siemens IT, fundamentally supporting our business, leveraging Data, AI and GenAI to drive transformational change.

What We Offer You


An attractive renumeration package
Access to employee share plans
30 days of paid vacation and a variety of flexible work schedules that allow time off for you and your family
2 to 3 days of mobile working per week as a global standard
Diverse health and wellness offerings
Barrier-free locations


Since each of over 300,000 employees feels that other benefits are particularly important, and we cannot list our entire benefit portfolio here, you can find more information here.

The individual benefits are subject to regulatory, contractual, or corporate conditions.

You’ll make an impact by


Data & AI Strategy Development
Developing and implementing data and AI strategies that align with our business and IT goals, driving strategic value and ensuring that our AI and data efforts have a measurable impact.
Leading the way in AI adoption — moving from initial experiments to fully scaled solutions that improve decision-making and efficiency.
Staying at the forefront of AI innovation, including emerging technologies like agentive AI, large language models, and autonomous systems.
Building and maintaining relationships with key technology partners, research institutions, and industry thought leaders.
AI & Data-Driven Operating Models
Designing operating models that leverage AI and data by integrating automation and predictive insights into our business processes.
Collaborating with business and IT leaders to embed AI and data capabilities into workflows, driving transformation and new business approaches.
Encouraging a culture of data-driven decision-making by ensuring that everyone has access to high-quality, well-governed data.
Developing and implementing change management strategies that support the transition to AI-enhanced operating models.
AI & Data Governance and Enablement
Helping to evolve our frameworks for AI and data governance to ensure that our solutions are scalable, ethical, and compliant.
Fostering AI and data literacy across Siemens by equipping teams with the skills and tools needed to effectively utilize AI and advanced analytics.
Collaboration & Influence
Working closely with relevant Centers of Excellence (CoEs) and internal innovation programs to define and standardize best practices, supporting the acceleration of AI adoption.
Engaging with senior leadership to influence decisions on AI and data investments, ensuring alignment with our long-term goals.
Supporting the continual development of our internal strategy capabilities — beyond just data & AI.


This Is How You'll Win Us Over


Education
Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, Business, or a related field.
Experience & Skills
At least 5 years of experience in AI, data strategy, analytics, or digital transformation, with a strong track record of implementing AI and data projects on an enterprise scale.
Background in consulting, enterprise AI leadership, or AI-first startups.
Proven expertise in change management, guiding organizations through AI-driven transitions.
Strong problem-solving, strategic thinking, and program management abilities.
Excellent communication and stakeholder engagement skills, with the ability for influencing senior executives and cross-functional teams.
Strong interest and extensive knowledge within the topics AI & Data.


You are much more than your qualifications, and we believe in the potential of every single candidate. We look forward to getting to know you!

Your individual personality and perspective are important to us. We create a working environment that reflects the diversity of the society and support you in your personal and professional development. Let’s get to know your authentic personality and create a better future together with us. As an equal-opportunity employer we are happy to consider applications from individuals with disabilities.

About Us

We know that our business thrives only when our people thrive and unlock their full potential. That’s why you are always our top priority. Our global, diverse team is ready to support, challenge, and inspire you, helping you grow in countless ways. Together, we’ll embark on an exciting journey of discovery. Who knows where this path will lead? Join us and take an active role in shaping your future!

www.siemens.de/careers – if you would like to find out more about jobs & careers at Siemens.

FAQ – if you need further information on the application process.

Title: Marketing/Product Data Analyst (m/f/x)
Description:
Carhartt WIP is part of the WIP Trading AG. Our family-owned business group started as a licensee and European distributor of the US workwear manufacturer Carhartt in the early 1990s. Since then, it develops its own collections based on workwear originals.




Carhartt Work In Progress aims to continuously progress and evolve, without ever losing sight of its origins. Over the course of the past two decades, our business has developed organically, along with its customers, the culture that surrounds the brand, and its employees who have helped shape what Carhartt WIP is today.




As a Data & Analytics Specialist (m/f/x) at Carhartt WIP, you will play a key role in enabling data-driven decision-making across our e-commerce teams. From leading analytics projects to managing BI systems and dashboards, you'll turn data into actionable insights that support business growth. This role requires a strong technical foundation, a deep understanding of the e-commerce landscape, and a proactive, hands-on mindset to drive meaningful impact across departments.




Your responsibilities:

Drive and execute analytics projects to support data-driven decision-making across e-commerce teams, including Paid Marketing, CRM, and Product.
Develop and analyze customer segments and audiences to drive personalized marketing, customer retention, and lifetime value.
Collaborate closely with internal stakeholders and external service providers, including ERP and BI teams.
Own and manage BI systems used within e-commerce (i.e. Looker, Power BI, Google Analytics), ensuring scalability, usability, and data integrity.
Design, build, and maintain key performance dashboards that provide actionable insights for e-commerce stakeholders.
Support tracking implementation (i.e. Google Tag Manager, Firebase, Adjust) and define relevant KPIs to effectively monitor and optimize business performance.
Translate complex business questions into analytical approaches. Present insights to stakeholders and product owners, turning data into action and supporting customer strategy.
Promote a data-driven mindset within the team. Provide methodological guidance and mentorship to junior colleagues, contributing to team development and knowledge-sharing.




Your Profile:

Relevant experience leveraging customer data to answer business questions and drive targeting strategies, including advanced statistical analysis. Strong quantitative background with a degree in Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Strong technical understanding of ERP systems, CommerceTools and data warehouse (DWH) architectures.
Deep knowledge of marketing and e-commerce analytics; hands-on experience working with tracking data (web and app) and integrating multiple data sources.
Advanced skills in data methodologies and technologies (Python and SQL) and visualization tools, e.g. Looker and Power BI.
Proven experience in a data-driven role within e-commerce or a similar digital environment.
Fast learner and problem solver; proactive, analytical, and solution-oriented team player.
Strong communicator with the ability to tell data stories and bridge commercial and technical perspectives; excellent written and spoken English; proficiency in German is an advantage.




Your Location:

Berlin / Germany
