Title: Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
🌈 WE AT FRIENDSURANCE




We believe that dealing with insurance should bring a smile to your face. We build the most intuitive B2B2C SaaS platform, making insurance all about the customer.

As a deeply engaged and capable Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d), you thrive on shaping a strong data culture and building insights-driven solutions that empower those around you.

You act as a key interface between business and data, translating complex information into clear, impactful decisions. In this role, you’ll engage in cross-functional collaboration, reporting, and the development of data products while contributing to strategic company initiatives.




✅ YOUR TASKS & RESPONSIBILITIES




Shape and define the information goals of the business and stakeholders.
Deliver the right reports, analyses, and data solutions using the most suitable tools and technologies for each task.
Identify and integrate useful data sources, collaborating with Data Engineers and stakeholders to build sustainable, end-to-end analytics solutions.
Co-own and evolve data models and business data structures to ensure consistency, scalability, and alignment with business needs.
Lead and support legacy data migrations, ensuring data integrity, efficiency, and seamless integration into modern systems.
Optimize and improve the analytics tech stack, continuously enhancing data processes and tooling.
Work closely with stakeholders to refine requirements and improve how data-driven priorities are set.
Shape the company's Data Strategy alongside the data team and company leadership.
Champion and contribute to a strong data culture across the organization.
Provide expert guidance and support, helping stakeholders obtain the insights they need to make decisions and track success.




🎯 YOU WILL CREATE IMPACT BY




Providing reliable and coherent business data to stakeholders in management and large B2B partners
Creating continuously improving self-service analytics solutions
Building up our data-models and domain-understanding across all company functions
Shape and deliver strategic projects around Data that create direct value




By the way - You don’t need to check all the boxes. We want to meet YOU!




👻 YOUR PROFILE




5+ years of experience in business intelligence and data analytics, delivering insights and reports that drive decision-making.
Proven track record of building insightful reports and conducting in-depth analysis using established reporting tools, preferably Tableau.
Strong SQL expertise with relational databases, especially PostgreSQL, as well as ANSI SQL/Snowflake. Bonus points for query optimization, big-data querying, and columnar storage experience.
Ability to architect and structure reporting and analytics frameworks in a systematic, reusable, and scalable way.
Excellent communication skills, enabling you to effectively convey insights to stakeholders and collaborate with technical and non-technical team members.
Experience with and affinity for Domain-Driven Design (DDD), and other data modeling fundamentals.
Self-sufficient in adopting new technologies and integrating diverse data sources, continuously expanding your analytics capabilities.
Knowledge of common third-party data sources and analytical tools, such as Google Analytics.
Bonus points for experience in adjacent fields like Data Science and Data Engineering (especially Python but also MATLAB, R, Machine Learning, MapReduce, etc.).
A highly professional, curious, proactive, and supportive mindset, driving collaboration and innovation.
Experience working successfully with colleagues from diverse cultural backgrounds.
Fluent in English (C1 or higher) is a must; German is a plus.




🫂 WE AS A TEAM




We are a tight-knit group in a founder-owned “grown-up” startup. We love what we do and what we build and we care about our amazing team. We value each team member and develop their unique talents.




At Friendsurance, we believe that today's social structures disproportionately disadvantage people from marginalized populations - including people of color, people with disabilities, working-class people, single parents, women, and members of LGBTQIA+ communities. We also believe that these groups need to be actively included in the workforce. Therefore, we strongly encourage people with these identities or members of other marginalized communities to apply. We do not require a photo or information about your gender/sex or marital status for our application process.




🤝 OUR OFFER




100% Remote in Germany, on-site in Berlin, or a mix as you wish
Flexible and family-friendly working hours
A big and lovely designed office in Berlin-Kreuzberg with quiet working conditions, plenty of meeting rooms, and your typical startup amenities
A generous personal development budget for all employees
Legendary team events and parties
Language classes
Urban Sports membership subsidy
Unlimited mental health support through OpenUp
A unique and international team
A people-focused management
And much more!




Sounds interesting? We are very much looking forward to your application ❤️

Show more

  • A generous personal development budget for all employees

  • Unlimited mental health support through OpenUp

  • A people-focused management
  • And much more!

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d) - SAP & Finance
Description:
At Statista, we’re all about facts and data, for we are the world's leading business data platform. By providing reliable and easy-to-use data as well as various data analytics products and services, we empower people worldwide to make fact-based decisions.

Founded in Hamburg in 2007, we have quickly grown into a global company with offices in major cities such as London, New York, Berlin and Tokyo. And we still have a lot of plans. Our constant growth does not only prove our success, but also keeps creating new development and career opportunities for our employees.

We value and celebrate our diverse culture. You are welcome here for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or whether you prefer bar graphs to pie charts. Your story matters – keep writing it as part of our team.

Are you ready to join us?

Tasks


Assume responsibility for the development and refinement of the data models in our Redshift data warehouse.
Help transition our current MS Navision-based financial reporting to a newly designed SAP-based reporting.
Act as a bridge between Finance Controlling, Finance Tech and Data Department. Systematically translate business requirements and questions into precise data queries and insightful data models.
Provide crucial support to our Embedded Analysts and Finance Controlling Team, aiding in their understanding and utilization of the data warehouse.
Engage with stakeholders across the organization driving value from our data.


Requirements


Proven proficiency in SQL and experience working with data warehouses like Redshift.
Hands-on data modeling skills and familiarity with dbt.
Understanding of SAP-data and the SAP-system as well as Finance processes.
Adeptness in translating business needs into data models.
Exceptional communication skills in both spoken and written in English. German is a plus.
Analytical mindset with the ability to identify patterns, trends, and insights from data.
Strong collaboration skills, with the ability to work closely with teams and stakeholders at all levels of the organization.


The team

At Statista Tech, our mission is to to harness the possibilities of modern technology to bring Statista’s data assets to the fingertips of our customers around the globe as conveniently and reliably as possible. Internally, we provide a productive digital workplace environment at Statista globally.

What We Offer

In addition to our great team, culture, and our shared goal of empowering people with data, there are many other things that make Statista a great place to work! Join us and benefit from:


Work from abroad 10 days a year (up to 30 if your family lives abroad)
Hybrid work and flex-time
International team and social events
Career & training opportunities
Attractive locations and modern offices
Mental health support with OpenUp


Some of the benefits listed here apply only to the German entity and to Junior-level roles or above.

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Growth Analytics
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, travelers from over 170 countries have booked more than 200 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 700 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics department's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement and take pride in the insights we generate.

This Organic Growth Analytics team works with marketeers, analysts, product managers, data scientists and engineers to create and promote a best-in-class marketplace product. You will also collaborate closely with the Marketing Analytics team that focuses on paid acquisition channels to create an aligned holistic view. Your team will build an understanding of how to utilise our organic growth channels to the maximum capacity, and support the teams to reach their targets via operational and strategic insights, identifying opportunities and enabling proper measurement.

You Will


Develop quantitative analysis to drive product and marketing decisions.
In collaboration with stakeholders identify organic growth opportunities and dependencies.
Collaborate with marketing analytics and Growth cluster leads to develop a comprehensive understanding of user acquisition and retention channels.
Design and implement data models, metrics and dashboards to guide the teams strategy and success.
Support the technical teams in tracking and producing more insightful data.
Contribute to the learning and experimentation culture of the company by promoting hypothesis-driven development and evaluation.
Answer the big questions to push our knowledge of our customers further.
Contribute to the strategic thinking of the team by being a thought partner to the Product Managers and Marketing Leads.


Who You Are


5+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Excellent stakeholder management
Strong knowledge of SQL and experience with statistical packages (e.g. R, Python)
Strong statistical background and proficiency with advanced statistical methods
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks)
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers, and translate them into actionable insights
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction in ambiguous situations and with highly engaged individuals
Strong customer-centric mindset with a focus on business impact
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Nice To Have


Experience in SEO and CRM analytics, and with growth data products is of significant benefit.
Familiarity with ETL technologies like Airflow is a plus.
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus.
Experience with LLM APIs (OpenAI, Gemini, Anthropic) is a plus.


How We Set You Up For Success


Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences
A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
English-speaking office environment
Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
GetYourGuide vouchers and free German lessons
Relocation assistance if needed


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Title: Data Analyst II - Hospitality Data Team
Description:
Hi there! Thanks for stopping by 👋

Are you actively looking for a new opportunity? Or just checking the market? Well… you might just be in the right place!

Lightspeed is a forward-thinking company dedicated to driving innovation in the hospitality industry through data. We leverage data insights to support strategic decisions and enhance our product offerings. As a Data Analyst 2, you will bring your expertise to an expanding team within the Hospitality unit's product department. This team acts as a strategic data partner, working closely with diverse product squads to provide expert insights and data-driven solutions that inform development decisions and optimize product performance. As a key player in shaping Lightspeed’s future, you’ll play an integral role in building actionable data expertise within our forward-looking organization.

What You'll Do


Collaborate with Cross-Functional Teams: Partner with Product Managers, Developers, Designers, and other stakeholders to understand their data needs, delivering tailored, strategic data solutions. Clearly communicate complex data insights to both technical and non-technical audiences, ensuring alignment across teams.
Lead Advanced Data Analysis: Perform and lead complex analyses, such as segmentation, customer health assessments, and impact measurements of development initiatives, guiding product direction and business decisions.
Develop Data Warehouse Solutions: Create, maintain, and test scalable data warehouse solutions using Python to ensure data integrity and reliability. Implement automated testing frameworks and leverage CI/CD pipelines to proactively identify opportunities for continuous improvement in data infrastructure.
DynamoDB Data Extraction and Visualization: Script advanced interactions with DynamoDB to extract data and develop real-time visualizations that provide critical business insights.
Dashboard and Report Development: Build, optimize, and innovate dashboards using tools like Heap and BigQuery to visualize key performance indicators (KPIs) and inform data-driven decisions.
Mentorship: Mentor and guide data analysts, fostering a collaborative, growth-oriented environment while exemplifying technical expertise and effective problem-solving.
Innovative Problem-Solving: Take ownership of complex data challenges, proactively supporting Product teams with data-driven insights that empower informed decision-making.
Generate Business Insights: Translate complex data sets into actionable business insights, helping teams understand product performance through behavioral analysis and key metrics.
Customer Data Platform Management: Optimize the data flow through platforms like Segment to ensure effective use of customer data in product development and customer success strategies.



What You'll Bring


Experience:
5+ years of professional experience using Python for data analysis, including advanced scripting and real-time data processing.
5+ years of experience with SQL, with familiarity in BigQuery and Dataform as a plus.
Experience scripting and accessing data in DynamoDB.
Technical Skills:
Python Proficiency: Expertise in data extraction, processing, and advanced analyses (Pydantic, Scikit-learn, Poetry).
SQL Proficiency: Advanced skills in SQL for querying large datasets and data manipulation.
Version Control: Experience with Git, including collaborating through commits, pull requests (PRs), and code reviews.
Data Warehousing: Strong knowledge of data warehouse development and testing using Python and SQL, with experience in cloud-based platforms such as BigQuery.
Data Visualization: Experience with real-time data visualization tools like Matplotlib, Plotly, or Dash.
As a Plus:
Experience with customer data platforms like Segment and analytics tools such as Heap.
Familiarity with AWS CLI and SDKs (e.g., Boto3 for Python) to interact with AWS.
Experience working with data warehouses, particularly Dataform or similar data transformation frameworks.
Business Acumen & Creativity: Ability to translate complex data into actionable business insights and present them effectively, with a creative approach to solving data challenges.


Collaborative Spirit

Thrive in a dynamic, cross-functional environment, working closely with various teams to meet business needs.

What’s in it for you


Lots of autonomy, flexible work culture with the option of working remotely or from one of our beautiful offices
Genuine career growth opportunities within a company that's continuously expanding
Be part of a team large enough for growth yet agile enough for real impact
Work on high-traffic products with a global user base
Opportunity to work alongside other highly skilled engineers, learn and expand your skill set, forge wonderful relationships and make your mark within the diverse and inclusive Lightspeed culture, a true Canadian tech success story



… and enjoy a range of benefits that’ll keep you happy and healthy:


Lightspeed share scheme (we are all owners).
Flexible working policy.
Mental health online platform and counseling & coaching services.
Health and wellness benefits.
LinkedIn Learning license (learning is always ongoing).
Volunteer day to be able to give back to society!



To all recruitment agencies: Lightspeed does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. If we have not directly engaged your company in writing to supply candidates for a specific vacancy, Lightspeed will not be responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Lightspeed is a proud equal opportunity employer and we are committed to creating an inclusive and barrier-free workplace. Lightspeed welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Where to from here?

Obviously, this has to be mutually beneficial: we want you to step into a role you love, and we want to offer you a place you’re proud to come to every day. For a glimpse into our world check out our career page here.

Lightspeed is building communities through commerce, and we need people from all backgrounds and lived experiences to do that. We were founded in 2005, in Montreal’s gay village and our original members were all part of the LGBTQ+ community. The ethos of our business has been about inclusion from the very beginning, and we strive to provide a workplace where everyone belongs.

Who We Are

Powering the businesses that are the backbone of the global economy, Lightspeed's one-stop commerce platform helps merchants innovate to simplify, scale, and provide exceptional customer experiences. Our cloud commerce solution transforms and unifies online and physical operations, multichannel sales, expansion to new locations, global payments, financial solutions, and connection to supplier networks.

Founded in Montréal, Canada in 2005, Lightspeed is dual-listed on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE: LSPD) and Toronto Stock Exchange (TSX: LSPD). With teams across North America, Europe, and Asia Pacific, the company serves retail, hospitality, and golf businesses in over 100 countries.

Lightspeed handles your information in accordance with our Applicant Privacy Statement.

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Vendor Sales & Operations (all genders)
Description:
About The Opportunity

We are on the lookout for a Senior Data Analyst (f/m/d) to join the Vendor Sales & Operations - Data Team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

The sustainable acquisition of good quality restaurants is a crucial part of Delivery Hero’s profitability goal. We focus on: what to acquire, where, how we should prioritize the backlog of leads, what channel is better for us to prioritize investments on our side, how do we enhance the vendor experience in the onboarding process, etc.

We focus on global initiative, and our main stakeholders are global product and business teams that are also focused on restaurant acquisition.

Your Mission:


Owning end to end the analytics part on multiple projects for the Vendor Management team (this can vary from Competitor intelligence, Digital Sales, Sales Enablement)
We focus on delivering data projects and adding value with actionable insights that help the business and product teams


What you need to be successful


Passion for data, problem-solving and generating actionable insights that impact the business
Highly proficient in SQL
Proficient using orchestration tools (preferably DBT + Airflow)
Proficient in Data visualization and storytelling
Proficient in at least one Visualisation tool (preferably Tableau)
Team player and ability to think outside the box
Communication skills
Ability to correctly present findings to senior stakeholders
Critical thinking and Business understanding


Nice to have:


Experience in AB Testing
Practical experience working with Git (or similar version control system)


Who we are

As the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe’s largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

What's in it for you

At Delivery Hero, we believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. Just be yourself and we can’t wait to see what value you bring to the role. We're as interested in your character as we are in your talent.

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience—just include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: BI-Analyst*in
Description:
Willst Du gemeinsam mit uns das 36.000 Kilometer lange Berliner Stromnetz fit halten, ausbauen und modernisieren? Willst Du Dich mit voller Kraft für unsere 3,7 Millionen Kund*innen und für eine nachhaltige Stadtgesellschaft engagieren?

Dann unterstütze uns zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt als

BI-Analyst*in

im Bereich System- und Dienstleistermanagement Metering in Berlin-Marienfelde.

Wir sind Stromnetz Berlin. Als Mitgestalter der Energiewende halten wir die Stadt am Laufen, geben ihr Energie und bringen sie zum Leuchten.

Mehr über uns erfährst Du hier: Über uns - Stromnetz Berlin

Der Bereich System- und Dienstleistermanagement Metering ist ein Stabstellenbereich der Abteilung Metering. Wir identifizieren aus dem Rechtsrahmen (u.a. MsbG) relevante Änderungsbedarfe und setzen diese um. Zusätzlich koordinieren wir als zentrales Team alle laufenden Projekte, das zentrale Prozessmanagement sowie den Betrieb von IT-Applikationen für die Abteilung. Darüber hinaus betreuen wir die Steuerung von IT-Dienstleistern des Bereiches Metering und sind für die dezentrale Koordination rund um das Thema ISMS verantwortlich.

Diese Aufgaben erwarten Dich:



Erhebung, Visualisierung und Auswertung kundenbezogener, energiewirtschaftlicher und prozessbezogener Kennzahlen zur Ableitung von Prognosen und geschäftsrelevanten Erkenntnissen.
Verarbeitung und gezielter Einsatz von Daten beispielsweise für die Optimierung der Prozesse. hinsichtlich der Durchlaufzeiten von Hausanschlüssen, PV-Anlagen, Ladeeinrichtungen oder Wärmepumpen.
Generieren von notwendigen Daten aus den zur Verfügung stehenden Systemen, Überprüfung der Datenquellen und Sicherstellung der Datenqualität sowie die Konzeption von aussagefähigen Reports und Dashboards zur Ableitung von erforderlichen Steuerungsmaßnahmen.
Entwicklung von RPAs zur Automatisierung manueller Arbeitsschritte.



Wir suchen jemanden mit:



einem erfolgreich abgeschlossenen Hoch- oder Fachhochschulstudium im Bereich der (Wirtschafts-) Informatik oder einer vergleichbaren Fachrichtung.
Darüber hinaus hast Du Spaß daran, Dich in Systeme, Prozesse und Datenstrukturen einzuarbeiten. Du möchtest Zusammenhänge verstehen und gemeinsam mit Deinen Kolleg*innen systemübergreifend eine plausible Datenlage herstellen sowie kontinuierlich zur Optimierung der Prozesse beitragen.
Du bringst eine hohe IT-Affinität, ein grundlegendes und übergreifendes Datenbankverständnis sowie erste Berufserfahrungen zur Durchführung von Datenanalysen mit.
Du besitzt umfangreiche MS Office- und MS Power Query Kenntnisse sowie fundiertes Wissen im Umgang mit Power BI oder einer anderen BI-Software.
Du zeichnest dich durch eine unternehmerische und analytische Denkweise aus, bist eigeninitiativ, engagiert, selbstständig und dabei gleichzeitig team- und kommunikationsfähig.



Das spricht für Deine Karriere bei uns:



Work-Life-Balance: Wir unterstützen die Vereinbarkeit von Familie, Freizeit und Beruf z.B. durch flexible Arbeitszeiten bei einer 37h-Woche, diversen Arbeitszeitmodellen (z.B. Sabbatical, Gleitzeit, Teilzeit etc.), 30 Tagen Urlaub/Jahr, arbeitsfreien Tagen an Weihnachten und Silvester sowie einem Jahresarbeitszeitkonto.
Persönliche Weiterentwicklung: Wir fördern Deine persönliche Entwicklung (z.B. durch Entwicklungsgespräche) und unterstützen Dich durch individuelle Weiterbildungsmaßnahmen (z.B. Projektleitung) und bieten Dir ein umfangreiches Angebot zur Gesundheitsförderung.
Gestaltungsspielraum: Wir bieten ein Umfeld mit viel Gestaltungsspielraum zur Eigeninitiative und eigenverantwortlichem Handeln sowie eine offene Kommunikationskultur.
Finanzielle Sicherheit: Du erhältst eine attraktive tarifliche Einstiegsvergütung zwischen 60.000 – 72.000 € in einem krisensicheren Unternehmen. Durch abweichende persönliche Voraussetzungen kann eine Eingruppierung zu Beginn auch niedriger erfolgen. Profitiere von weiteren Leistungen wie einem Zuschuss zum Jobticket, vergünstigtem Mittagessen sowie einem Jobrad-Leasing und einer betrieblichen Altersvorsorge.
Standort Berlin: Durch unsere Kooperation mit einem Berliner Wohnungsunternehmen unterstützen wir Dich beim schnellen Ankommen in Berlin, sofern Du für den Job nach Berlin ziehen müsstest.



So wird Stromnetz Berlin als Arbeitgeber (kununu.com) gesehen.

Bunt – spannend – vielfältig – Berlin.

Wir sind überzeugt von Vielfalt und Inklusion. Bewerbungen von Menschen jeglichen Alters, geschlechtlicher Identität, sexueller Orientierung sowie mit Migrationsgeschichte sind herzlich willkommen. Da wir uns Chancengleichheit und die berufliche Förderung von Frauen zum Ziel gesetzt haben, sind wir an Bewerbungen von Frauen besonders interessiert. Menschen mit Behinderung werden bei gleicher fachlicher Eignung besonders berücksichtigt.

Das hört sich gut an? Dann freuen wir uns auf Deine Bewerbung – gern unter Angabe Deiner Kündigungsfrist sowie Deiner Gehaltsvorstellung.

Hast Du Fragen? Wir helfen Dir gerne:

Informationen zum Job: Katharina Hatzogiannis, Telefon: +49 160 983 36 670.

Informationen zum Bewerbungsprozess: Janice Schneider, Telefon: +491701889872.
Show more
HTML:
Willst Du gemeinsam mit uns das 36.000 Kilometer lange Berliner Stromnetz fit halten, ausbauen und modernisieren? Willst Du Dich mit voller Kraft für unsere 3,7 Millionen Kund*innen und für eine nachhaltige Stadtgesellschaft engagieren?

Dann unterstütze uns zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt als

BI-Analyst*in

im Bereich System- und Dienstleistermanagement Metering in Berlin-Marienfelde.

Wir sind Stromnetz Berlin. Als Mitgestalter der Energiewende halten wir die Stadt am Laufen, geben ihr Energie und bringen sie zum Leuchten.

Mehr über uns erfährst Du hier: Über uns - Stromnetz Berlin

Der Bereich System- und Dienstleistermanagement Metering ist ein Stabstellenbereich der Abteilung Metering. Wir identifizieren aus dem Rechtsrahmen (u.a. MsbG) relevante Änderungsbedarfe und setzen diese um. Zusätzlich koordinieren wir als zentrales Team alle laufenden Projekte, das zentrale Prozessmanagement sowie den Betrieb von IT-Applikationen für die Abteilung. Darüber hinaus betreuen wir die Steuerung von IT-Dienstleistern des Bereiches Metering und sind für die dezentrale Koordination rund um das Thema ISMS verantwortlich.

Diese Aufgaben erwarten Dich:


  • Erhebung, Visualisierung und Auswertung kundenbezogener, energiewirtschaftlicher und prozessbezogener Kennzahlen zur Ableitung von Prognosen und geschäftsrelevanten Erkenntnissen.
  • Verarbeitung und gezielter Einsatz von Daten beispielsweise für die Optimierung der Prozesse. hinsichtlich der Durchlaufzeiten von Hausanschlüssen, PV-Anlagen, Ladeeinrichtungen oder Wärmepumpen.
  • Generieren von notwendigen Daten aus den zur Verfügung stehenden Systemen, Überprüfung der Datenquellen und Sicherstellung der Datenqualität sowie die Konzeption von aussagefähigen Reports und Dashboards zur Ableitung von erforderlichen Steuerungsmaßnahmen.
  • Entwicklung von RPAs zur Automatisierung manueller Arbeitsschritte.


Wir suchen jemanden mit:


  • einem erfolgreich abgeschlossenen Hoch- oder Fachhochschulstudium im Bereich der (Wirtschafts-) Informatik oder einer vergleichbaren Fachrichtung.
  • Darüber hinaus hast Du Spaß daran, Dich in Systeme, Prozesse und Datenstrukturen einzuarbeiten. Du möchtest Zusammenhänge verstehen und gemeinsam mit Deinen Kolleg*innen systemübergreifend eine plausible Datenlage herstellen sowie kontinuierlich zur Optimierung der Prozesse beitragen.
  • Du bringst eine hohe IT-Affinität, ein grundlegendes und übergreifendes Datenbankverständnis sowie erste Berufserfahrungen zur Durchführung von Datenanalysen mit.
  • Du besitzt umfangreiche MS Office- und MS Power Query Kenntnisse sowie fundiertes Wissen im Umgang mit Power BI oder einer anderen BI-Software.
  • Du zeichnest dich durch eine unternehmerische und analytische Denkweise aus, bist eigeninitiativ, engagiert, selbstständig und dabei gleichzeitig team- und kommunikationsfähig.


Das spricht für Deine Karriere bei uns:


  • Work-Life-Balance: Wir unterstützen die Vereinbarkeit von Familie, Freizeit und Beruf z.B. durch flexible Arbeitszeiten bei einer 37h-Woche, diversen Arbeitszeitmodellen (z.B. Sabbatical, Gleitzeit, Teilzeit etc.), 30 Tagen Urlaub/Jahr, arbeitsfreien Tagen an Weihnachten und Silvester sowie einem Jahresarbeitszeitkonto.
  • Persönliche Weiterentwicklung: Wir fördern Deine persönliche Entwicklung (z.B. durch Entwicklungsgespräche) und unterstützen Dich durch individuelle Weiterbildungsmaßnahmen (z.B. Projektleitung) und bieten Dir ein umfangreiches Angebot zur Gesundheitsförderung.
  • Gestaltungsspielraum: Wir bieten ein Umfeld mit viel Gestaltungsspielraum zur Eigeninitiative und eigenverantwortlichem Handeln sowie eine offene Kommunikationskultur.
  • Finanzielle Sicherheit: Du erhältst eine attraktive tarifliche Einstiegsvergütung zwischen 60.000 – 72.000 € in einem krisensicheren Unternehmen. Durch abweichende persönliche Voraussetzungen kann eine Eingruppierung zu Beginn auch niedriger erfolgen. Profitiere von weiteren Leistungen wie einem Zuschuss zum Jobticket, vergünstigtem Mittagessen sowie einem Jobrad-Leasing und einer betrieblichen Altersvorsorge.
  • Standort Berlin: Durch unsere Kooperation mit einem Berliner Wohnungsunternehmen unterstützen wir Dich beim schnellen Ankommen in Berlin, sofern Du für den Job nach Berlin ziehen müsstest.

Title: Product Analyst, Seamless - (Logistics)
Description:
About The Opportunity

We are on the lookout for an experienced Product Analyst - Logistics (all genders) to join the Customer Product Line, Logistics Analytics Team, on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

In Logistics, we build products and shape processes towards an amazing delivery experience for our customers, riders, and service. The role is for Seamless domain in the Customer Product Line. In the Seamless Analytics team, we curate data to uncover insights, work closely with the product, enable self-service discovery, and drive the strategic development of Logistics functions. Being embedded in the Product Line, we foster the “data-first” mindset and drive change in product development.

As a Product Analyst, you will bring insights for one or more domains, collaborate with a team of about 5-7 analysts, drive projects across various data functions, collaborate with Data Science and Backend Engineers and enable our stakeholders in Product, Tech, and Operations to make data-driven decisions.


Engaging with key stakeholders to understand the business vision, requirements & priorities and helping to translate this into actionable insights
Build accessible, creative and engaging data visualizations to facilitate access to insights
Develop and curate unstructured data in collaboration with Data Engineering, Product and Operations
Refine, challenge and support requests from stakeholders and generate new data analyses
Lead data exploration projects, and help identify and define future insight and data needs to support various business initiatives
Own our data catalog for all Logistics dimensions, metrics and KPIs
Be an active player in working with and understanding the product end to end, its features and gaps and provide useful and necessary insights to the team to improve the product always
Ensuring proper AB testing for the features that we launch, sharing insights from the significance tests


In our Logistics Team, you’ll tackle high-impact challenges that make last-mile delivery efficient, affordable, and sustainable. Your work will directly improve experiences for riders, end customers, and merchants across the globe. Each enhancement you contribute will help Delivery Hero optimize delivery operations, supporting expansion into new areas like grocery and retail.

What you need to be successful


2-4 years experience as a BI/Data/Product analyst working for internet companies
Bachelor's degree or higher in a quantitative subject (e.g. computer science, physics, mathematics, engineering, statistics)
Excellent SQL skills, with practical experience of big data tools (ideally BigQuery)
Intermediate Python skills, with practical experience
You are creative in data visualization (Tableau experience is a plus)
Experience with version control systems (VCS) (e.g. Github)
Proven team player behavior and process-oriented mindset
Independent and rigorous working style, appreciation for Agile environments
Good English communication skills
Experience in dealing with stakeholders and challenging the scope of projects
Proven record of adopting and improving team standards and processes
Highly passionate about data, with creative problem-solving abilities and an eye for detail
Nice to have: Experience with orchestration tools such as airflow, DBT, metaflow


Who we are

As the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe’s largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

What's in it for you

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we’ll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
Look up and go for it. We will support you in developing yourself and your career: 1.000 € Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.


Ready to join our team? If you’re excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world’s leading delivery platform, we’d love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience—just include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Data Engineer (m/w/d)
Description:
Unternehmensbeschreibung

Möchtest du digitale Lösungen entwickeln, die den Journalismus auf das nächste Level bringen? In der Ströer Content Group Product & Tech arbeiten über 150 Expert:innen an innovativen Konzepten.

Unser Herzstück ist t-online.de, Deutschlands führende Nachrichten- und Ratgeberplattform. Mit einem einzigartigen Multiscreen-Konzept erreicht t-online millionen Nutzer:innen über alle digitalen Kanäle und setzt auf multimediales Storytelling, das sich an aktuellen Trends und Nutzer:innenverhalten orientiert.

Unsere Verticals wie Giga.de und kino.de ergänzen unser Angebot für die Generation Y. Wir schaffen Premium-Inhalte, die von Digital Natives konsumiert werden.

Denkst du kreativ und möchtest deine Ideen einbringen? Gestalte mit uns die Zukunft des digitalen Publishings!

Bei uns kannst Du mehr draus machen: Als Data Engineer (m/w/d) übernimmst Du eine Schlüsselrolle in der Entwicklung und Optimierung unserer datengetriebenen Prozesse. Du gestaltest innovative Lösungen für ETL/ELT, Datenpipelines und Machine-Learning-Modelle – und das in einer hochmodernen Cloud-Umgebung. Werde Teil unseres agilen Teams und bring Deine Expertise ein, um Datenströme effizienter und intelligenter zu machen.

Stellenbeschreibung


Du designst und entwickelst ETL-/ELT-Prozesse und sorgst für eine performante Datenverarbeitung und -analyse
Du baust und betreibst Datenpipelines, die Echtzeitdaten liefern und unterstützt Teams bei der Entwicklung von datengetriebenen Produkten (Personalisierung, Recommendations, Tracking)
Du entwickelst Schnittstellen zu externen Systemen und sorgst für eine zuverlässige Integration neuer Datenquellen (z. B. REST APIs, Google Analytics)
Du automatisierst Test- und Deployment-Prozesse von Datenmodellen, ETL-Jobs und Machine-Learning-Anwendungen
Du kümmerst dich um Infrastrukturkomponenten für Big Data und Streaming-Technologien (z. B. ClickHouse, Kinesis) und stellst deren hohe Verfügbarkeit und Effizienz sicher
Du verantwortest die Sicherstellung einer hohen Datenqualität und entwickelst Maßnahmen zur kontinuierlichen Optimierung der Systeme
Du arbeitest an der Entwicklung und Integration von Machine-Learning-Modellen zur Unterstützung unserer Personalisierungs- und Recommendation-Systeme
Du bist aktiver Teil unseres DevOps-Teams und übernimmst Verantwortung im Rahmen der Rufbereitschaft
Du dokumentierst technische Abläufe und sorgst für Transparenz und Nachvollziehbarkeit aller Datenprozesse


Qualifikationen


Mindestens 3 Jahre Berufserfahrung als Data Engineer oder im Bereich Schnittstellenentwicklung und Datenintegration
Fundierte Kenntnisse in ETL/ELT-Prozessen, SQL (PostgreSQL), NoSQL-Datenbanken sowie Workflow-Management (z. B. Airflow)
Umfangreiche Erfahrung im Umgang mit BigQuery, Google Analytics 4 (GA4) und Echtzeit-Tracking-Technologien
Kenntnisse im Bereich Big Data, Streaming (z. B. ClickHouse, Kinesis) und Personalisierungstechnologien
Erfahrung im Training und in der Produktivsetzung von Machine-Learning-Modellen
Erfahrung mit Infrastructure-as-Code (idealerweise Terraform) und sicherer Umgang mit Linux-Systemen
Ausgeprägte analytische Fähigkeiten, Problemlösungskompetenz und Kommunikationsstärke
Zielorientierte Arbeitsweise, agiles Mindset und Freude an der Arbeit im Team


Zusätzliche Informationen


Feelgood: Ob frisches Obst & Müsli zum gemeinsamen Frühstück mit Blick auf die Speicherstadt am Standort Hamburg, Recreation Rooms in Frankfurt/Main & München, Lounge mit Playstation in Berlin - jeder Standort hat seinen eigenen Charme
Flexibility: Keine Lust auf Rush Hour? Bei uns hast Du die Möglichkeit auch aus dem Home Office zu arbeiten
Community: Wir übernehmen Verantwortung und sorgen für mehr Nachhaltigkeit und Diversität am Arbeitsplatz – engagiere Dich z.B. in unserer Nachhaltigkeitswerkstatt oder werde Mitglied in einer unserer Communities wie LGBTQ+ oder unserem Frauennetzwerk
Company: Sie oder Du? Bei uns findest Du ein kommunikatives und respektvolles Miteinander per „Du“ , das durch eine offene Kultur geprägt ist . Als Konzern legen wir besonderen Wert auf die berufliche Gleichstellung unserer Mitarbeiter:innen
Learn & Grow: Gestaltungsspielraum für Deine kreativen Ideen sowie fachliche und persönliche Weiterentwicklungsmöglichkeiten, z.B. in unserem internen Talenteprogramm, zeichnen die bunte Ströer-Welt aus
On Top: Profitiere durch unsere Benefits und nutze die Möglichkeit eines bezuschussten Mittagessens oder lease Dir vergünstigt ein Fahrrad und genieße exklusive Rabatte in vielen Shops

Title: BESS Data Analyst (m/w/d) for Equipment Health Monitoring
Description:
Stellenbeschreibung

At RollsRoyce Powersystems we develop and build Battery Energy Storage Systems (BESS). Additionally, we offer Long-Term Service Agreements (LTSA). In order to ensure the highest availability possible, we analyze operational data and predict on future scenarios. For this work we need a Data Analyst to develop and improve our Dashboards for our Equipment Health Monitoring (EHM). Therefore, this role is part of our Service Team for BESS.

Tasks – What to expect from us:



Support our Equipment Health Monitoring Team to create Dashboards for different type of users on our Cloud platform.
Analyzing in-field battery energy storage systems.
Calculating and comparing health and performance KPIs between in-field systems.
In case of on-site problems, perform data analysis and troubleshoot the problems in collaboration with the service team and with engineers.
Create detailed reports describing the issues, root causes, and suggested remedies.
Cooperate with our suppliers and their technical teams.


Qualifications – Who we are looking for:



Background in electrical engineering and system control and automation.
Very good knowledge of battery energy storage systems and new technologies such as microgrids.
Ideally, previous experience in the battery energy storage system industry.
Very good knowledge of data analysis tools (mainly python) and their different libraries. (Pandas, NumPy, Seaborn and visualization libraries such as Matplotlib, Plotly). Experience in Apache PySpark is a plus.
Proficiency in English and German both written and spoken.
You are able to work independently and have a problem-solving mindset.


Why Rolls-Royce Power Systems – What you will get:



Company-owned health insurance BKK MTU for our employees and their family members
Comprehensive corporate health management including a company fitness program (EGYM Wellpass)
Attractive company pension scheme – Save for your retirement with us!
Disability insurance – Protection for all cases!
Mobility support in everyday life – JobTicket and JobRad
Corporate benefits program – Great employee discounts on numerous strong brands


We are an equal opportunities employer. We’re committed to developing a diverse workforce and an inclusive working environment. We believe that people from different backgrounds and cultures give us different perspectives. And the more perspectives we have, the more successful we’ll be. By building a culture of respect and appreciation, we give everyone who works here the opportunity to realise their full potential. You can learn more about our global Inclusion strategy here.

Your contact person

Ana Maria De Los Rios

careers@ps.rolls-royce.com

Note: Please apply exclusively online through our career portal. Applications through other channels (especially via email) cannot be considered.

Vertragsart

Permanent
Show more
HTML:
Stellenbeschreibung

At RollsRoyce Powersystems we develop and build Battery Energy Storage Systems (BESS). Additionally, we offer Long-Term Service Agreements (LTSA). In order to ensure the highest availability possible, we analyze operational data and predict on future scenarios. For this work we need a Data Analyst to develop and improve our Dashboards for our Equipment Health Monitoring (EHM). Therefore, this role is part of our Service Team for BESS.

Tasks – What to expect from us:


  • Support our Equipment Health Monitoring Team to create Dashboards for different type of users on our Cloud platform.
  • Analyzing in-field battery energy storage systems.
  • Calculating and comparing health and performance KPIs between in-field systems.
  • In case of on-site problems, perform data analysis and troubleshoot the problems in collaboration with the service team and with engineers.
  • Create detailed reports describing the issues, root causes, and suggested remedies.
  • Cooperate with our suppliers and their technical teams.

Qualifications – Who we are looking for:


  • Background in electrical engineering and system control and automation.
  • Very good knowledge of battery energy storage systems and new technologies such as microgrids.
  • Ideally, previous experience in the battery energy storage system industry.
  • Very good knowledge of data analysis tools (mainly python) and their different libraries. (Pandas, NumPy, Seaborn and visualization libraries such as Matplotlib, Plotly). Experience in Apache PySpark is a plus.
  • Proficiency in English and German both written and spoken.
  • You are able to work independently and have a problem-solving mindset.

Why Rolls-Royce Power Systems – What you will get:


  • Company-owned health insurance BKK MTU for our employees and their family members
  • Comprehensive corporate health management including a company fitness program (EGYM Wellpass)
  • Attractive company pension scheme – Save for your retirement with us!
  • Disability insurance – Protection for all cases!
  • Mobility support in everyday life – JobTicket and JobRad
  • Corporate benefits program – Great employee discounts on numerous strong brands

We are an equal opportunities employer. We’re committed to developing a diverse workforce and an inclusive working environment. We believe that people from different backgrounds and cultures give us different perspectives. And the more perspectives we have, the more successful we’ll be. By building a culture of respect and appreciation, we give everyone who works here the opportunity to realise their full potential. You can learn more about our global Inclusion strategy here.

Your contact person

Ana Maria De Los Rios

careers@ps.rolls-royce.com

Note: Please apply exclusively online through our career portal. Applications through other channels (especially via email) cannot be considered.

Permanent

Title: Senior Growth Data Analyst
Description:
Crazy Labs is one of the world’s leading mobile game developers and publishers, specializing in hyper-casual, hybrid, and casual spaces. With over 7 billion downloads, we have a deep understanding of what it takes to transform promising game ideas into profitable hits.

We are looking for a Growth Analyst specializing in marketing and ad monetization to optimize business performance through data-driven insights. This role focuses on analyzing user acquisition, ad revenue, and player engagement to drive growth and enhance monetization strategies.

Key Responsibilities:


Data Analysis & Insights: Analyze marketing, user acquisition, and ad monetization data to identify trends and optimize strategies.
Performance Tracking: Develop standardized dashboards and real-time reports to monitor key KPIs and support decision-making.
Campaign Optimization: Support A/B testing, attribution modeling, and budget allocation to maximize efficiency and ROAS.
Creatives & UA Analysis: Identify high-performing channels, campaigns, and creatives to refine ad monetization and acquisition strategies.
Ad Monetization Growth: Collaborate with the Ad Monetization team to track, visualize, and optimize revenue performance.
Cross-Team Collaboration: Work closely with Game Analysts, R&D, and Product teams to enhance engagement and monetization strategies.
Statistical Modeling & Forecasting: Utilize SQL, Python, or R to predict growth opportunities and optimize marketing performance.


Requirements:


Experience: 3-5 years in marketing (user acquisition) analytics within mobile gaming.
Technical Skills: Strong proficiency in SQL & Python; experience with Tableau is a plus
Marketing & Monetization Expertise: Understanding of UA channels, ad mediation, and key metrics like LTV, ARPU, and eCPM.
Analytical Mindset: Ability to run statistical analyses, forecast trends, and generate actionable insights.
Collaboration: Strong communication skills to work with cross-functional teams and optimize data-driven strategies.
Show more

Title: Datenanalyst:in
Description:
Mach Daten zur Entscheidungsgrundlage.




DINA entwickelt Technologien für funktionale und Cybersicherheit in Maschinen. Unsere Lösungen sorgen dafür, dass industrielle Systeme zuverlässig, sicher und zukunftsfähig bleiben.

Wir setzen auf datengetriebene Entscheidungen – aber da geht noch mehr. Mit deiner Expertise als Data Analyst (w/m/x) bringst du Struktur in unsere Kundendaten, entwickelst aussagekräftige Analysen und sorgst dafür, dass Daten zum integralen Bestandteil unserer Geschäftsstrategie werden.




Wir arbeiten in einer Holokratie – das bedeutet: keine starren Hierarchien, keine langen Entscheidungswege, sondern Verantwortung von Tag eins an. Wenn du gestalten willst, statt nur zu verwalten, bist du hier richtig.







Deine Aufgaben




Customer Journey Analytics: Du analysierst die gesamte Customer Journey – von Marketing über Sales bis zu Customer Success – und leitest daraus klare Handlungsempfehlungen ab.
Dashboards & Reporting: Du entwickelst Dashboards für Umsatzprognosen, Deal-Pipelines, Marketing-Performance und Kundenzufriedenheit.
Revenue Operations (RevOps): Deine Analysen helfen dabei, Prozesse zu optimieren und datenbasierte Geschäftsentscheidungen zu treffen.
Datenintegration & Engineering: Du optimierst die Anbindung und Nutzung unserer Daten aus CRM (HubSpot) und ERP (SAP Business One).
Preis- & Rabattanalysen: Du erkennst Muster, analysierst Rabattstrukturen und hilfst, die Preisstrategie zu optimieren.
Zukunftsperspektive: Du treibst das Thema Daten in der Organisation voran und hast die Möglichkeit, unser Data-Team mit aufzubauen.







Dein Profil




Analytische Stärke & Business-Sinn – Du verstehst, welche Zahlen wirklich relevant sind und wie man sie sinnvoll nutzt.
Kommerzielles Gespür – Du erkennst, welche datenbasierten Entscheidungen direkten Einfluss auf das Geschäft haben.
Visualisierung – Du bereitest Daten so auf, dass sie sofort verständlich und einprägsam sind.
Storytelling mit Daten – Du kannst aus Zahlen eine klare, überzeugende Geschichte machen, die Entscheidungen vorantreibt.
Eigenverantwortung & Proaktivität – Du wartest nicht auf Aufgaben, sondern siehst, was getan werden muss – und setzt es um.
Erfahrung in der Datenanalyse – 3-5 Jahre Erfahrung mit SQL, idealerweise ergänzt durch Tableau, Power BI oder Looker.
Technisches Verständnis – Du kannst mit APIs umgehen und hast Grundkenntnisse in der Datenintegration.
Kommunikation auf Augenhöhe – Du kannst mit Sales, Marketing und Management sprechen – und bringst deine Analysen auf den Punkt.







Das bekommst du von uns




Täglicher Team-Lunch – Dein Mittagessen geht auf uns.
Firmenfitness – Zugang zu Gympass, Wellpass oder Urban Sports.
Weiterbildung & Coaching – Dein Budget für Schulungen & Konferenzen.
Ausstattung nach Wahl – Laptop, Monitor & Headset nach deinen Bedürfnissen.
Mehr Eigenverantwortung – Entscheidungen treffen, statt auf Vorgaben warten.
Klare Rollen & Transparenz – Jeder weiß, wer wofür verantwortlich ist.
Gestaltungsspielraum – Deine Ideen bewegen etwas – in Prozessen, Strategie & Technologie.
Interdisziplinäre Zusammenarbeit – Arbeiten in Kreisen, nicht in Abteilungen.
Betriebliche Altersvorsorge – 40 € VWL + 25 € Zuschuss von uns.
Team-Workshops & Offsites – Zweimal im Jahr gemeinsame Strategie & Weiterentwicklung.
Flexibel & agil – Deine Rolle wächst mit dir, nicht umgekehrt.




Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Our Story




At think-cell, we create powerful software solutions that help professionals be more efficient and productive. Founded in 2002 and based in Berlin, our tools integrate seamlessly with Microsoft Office to help users create presentations, charts, and diagrams with ease. Our dynamic, international team values creativity, collaboration, and technical excellence.




How your role will look like:




You collaborate with business owners to understand their objectives, strategies, and KPI requirements to translate them into data solutions and actionable insights
You design and implement business logic, data models and visualizations by using various methods and technologies such as SQL, Python and BI tools
You contribute to a valuable, robust and performant data platform by e.g. optimizing code, debugging anomalies and writing documentation




You will be great for this position if you have

At least 8 years of working experience in a Data Analytics environment, ideally in a similar business (Online / eCommerce)
Strong general knowledge of “how to work with data”, e.g. statistical methods, data preparation & visualization, transfer from data via analyses into actionable insights
Advanced data analytics experience with using e.g. Python or R and very good SQL skills
Experience in data modelling and BI-Tool experience, ideally PowerBi and understanding of data architecture concepts
Experience in working with Google Analytics / Matomo data
Experience in Git
Solid understanding of tracking concepts (frontend/backend)
Solid A/B testing experience
Strong ability to work both independent and as a part of the team
Strong communication and stakeholder management skills
Well structured, detail-oriented working style with a passion for efficient documentation
Desire to succeed as a team by creating synergies over individual success
Capable of outlining and presenting complex issues in an easy-to-understand manner
Great understanding of eCommerce businesses (products & challenges)
Very good language skills in English and optionally also in German




Our Values




As part of our team, you will embody and help shape the following principles that define us:




Forward Thinking: We embrace change and challenge the status quo.
Ownership: We take pride in our work and learn from our mistakes.
Customer First: We prioritize delivering lasting value.
Unified Team: We foster collaboration, respect, and integrity.
Strive for Excellence: We set ambitious goals and pursue quality.




Why is think-cell the right place for you?




We empower over 1.2 million users across 30,000 companies, including top consulting firms and major global enterprises. With offices in Berlin, Denver, Boston, London, Tokyo, and Dubai, we’re a diverse team of over 150 people, committed to innovation and excellence.




Think-cell is more than a job – it's a chance to be part of an innovative, inclusive team that values collaboration and growth. We encourage applicants from all backgrounds to apply. Together, we can shape the future of productivity software. We can’t wait to see what you’ll bring to the team!

Title: Staff Data Analyst
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, travelers from over 170 countries have booked more than 150 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 700 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics team's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement, and take pride in the insights we generate.

You Will


Develop quantitative analysis to initiate and drive business decisions focusing on supply strategy
Help the supply business and tech teams learn about their features by designing and analyzing Experiments.
Design and implement metrics, dashboards, and reports to guide the teams’ strategy and success.
Support the technical teams in tracking and producing more insightful data.
Contribute to the learning and experimentation culture of the company by promoting hypothesis-driven product and operational development and evaluation.


Who You Are


8+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Ability to collaborate with multiple teams to drive strategic decisions and execute on them
Strong project management skills
Strong knowledge of SQL and knowledge of Python
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks)
Curiosity and reasoning skills with proven evidence of problem-solving.
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Nice To Have


Previous experience working with agile product teams is a plus.
Experienced with the statistics and assumptions of experimentation.
Familiarity with ETL technologies like Airflow is a plus.
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus


How We Set You Up For Success


Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences
A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
English-speaking office environment
Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
Well-stocked kitchen and team-building events like our famous pizza & beer Fridays
GetYourGuide vouchers and free German lessons
Relocation assistance if needed


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Title: Working Student - Data Analytics (m/f/d)
Description:
1KOMMA5°

We are looking for you to join our Business Intelligence team to push 1KOMMA5° towards becoming a truly data-driven organization. 1KOMMA5° is building Germany's largest one-stop-shop for the sale, installation and services related to solar, heat pumps, electricity and charging infrastructure. And they are all connected!

Become a part of our mission and learn more about our Product & Tech team!

Your mission

As a data analytics working student at 1KOMMA5°, you support our teams along the Virtual Assembly Line by delivering data and reporting solutions that enable informed decision-making. You will play a key role in transforming and preparing data, ensuring it is accessible and actionable for stakeholders. In addition to the technical aspects, you will collaborate closely with stakeholders to analyze data, derive insights, and support strategic decisions.

Key Responsibilities Include, But Are Not Limited To


Building end-to-end data pipelines to ensure overall data availability
Independently developing dashboards, and reports in Looker
Performing ad hoc analyses and gathering stakeholder requests to generate actionable insights
Supporting the development of the Virtual Assembly Line, a strategic instrument for real-time monitoring across our whole value chain


Your profile


You are enrolled at a university and contribute 20 hours per week
You are studying Data Science, Computer Science, Information Systems, Industrial Engineering, or a comparable STEM course of studies
You have experience working with SQL, Python, and ideally Git, as well as handling large datasets, including ingestion, in-warehouse transformations, and data modeling
You have prior experience with BI tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau, Power BI)
You are an effective communicator, looking forward to much interaction with team members and stakeholders
You bring a proactive attitude and don't forget to have fun at work
You have very good written and spoken German and English skills


Benefits


You are part of an international, dynamic, and highly motivated team of people who have proven to make things happen
With your work, you accelerate the "energy transition" and hence have a direct impact on our climate
Work with and learn from other super-smart colleagues
You will enjoy direct contact with core decision-makers
You will enjoy the best chances of entering full-time in one of Europe’s most thriving scaleups
You work remotely (Germany-wide), with offices in Hamburg, Berlin or Munich
Create a healthy balance alongside your work and enjoy all the benefits of the EGYM Wellpass


About Us

"At 1KOMMA5°, our vision is to accelerate CO2 neutral life for all! We created an easy one-stop-shop to buy and install solar, charging stations and heat pumps, with the purpose of liberating all European homes from the shackles of fossil fuels. With Heartbeat, we make clean energy smarter. Connecting our customers into one powerful clean energy operating system to enable flexible tariffs and to ultimately follow the rhythm of wind and sun!" - Philipp Schröder (CEO 1KOMMA5°)
Show more

You will play a key role in transforming and preparing data, ensuring it is accessible and actionable for stakeholders. In addition to the technical aspects, you will collaborate closely with stakeholders to analyze data, derive insights, and support strategic decisions.

Key Responsibilities Include, But Are Not Limited To

  • Building end-to-end data pipelines to ensure overall data availability
  • Independently developing dashboards, and reports in Looker
  • Performing ad hoc analyses and gathering stakeholder requests to generate actionable insights
  • Supporting the development of the Virtual Assembly Line, a strategic instrument for real-time monitoring across our whole value chain

Your profile

  • You are enrolled at a university and contribute 20 hours per week
  • You are studying Data Science, Computer Science, Information Systems, Industrial Engineering, or a comparable STEM course of studies
  • You have experience working with SQL, Python, and ideally Git, as well as handling large datasets, including ingestion, in-warehouse transformations, and data modeling
  • You have prior experience with BI tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau, Power BI)
  • You are an effective communicator, looking forward to much interaction with team members and stakeholders
  • You bring a proactive attitude and don't forget to have fun at work
  • You have very good written and spoken German and English skills

Benefits

  • You are part of an international, dynamic, and highly motivated team of people who have proven to make things happen
  • With your work, you accelerate the "energy transition" and hence have a direct impact on our climate
  • Work with and learn from other super-smart colleagues
  • You will enjoy direct contact with core decision-makers
  • You will enjoy the best chances of entering full-time in one of Europe’s most thriving scaleups
  • You work remotely (Germany-wide), with offices in Hamburg, Berlin or Munich
  • Create a healthy balance alongside your work and enjoy all the benefits of the EGYM Wellpass

About Us

"At 1KOMMA5°, our vision is to accelerate CO2 neutral life for all! We created an easy one-stop-shop to buy and install solar, charging stations and heat pumps, with the purpose of liberating all European homes from the shackles of fossil fuels. With Heartbeat, we make clean energy smarter. Connecting our customers into one powerful clean energy operating system to enable flexible tariffs and to ultimately follow the rhythm of wind and sun!" - Philipp Schröder (CEO 1KOMMA5°)

Title: Data & Analytics Consulting - Intern (m/d/f)
Description:
Who We Are




Oliver Wyman is a global management consultancy working across all areas of industry, financial services, government, and non-profit organizations. Clients approach us with their most significant challenges, and we assemble teams of experts to address each facet of these complex issues. Together, we create breakthroughs that lead to remarkable impact.

Within Oliver Wyman, the Data and Analytics (DNA) division was established in 2017 and is operating across the entire world, with a focus on Europe. We are a dynamic and rapidly growing team of quantitative analytics specialists, collaborating closely with colleagues across the firm to cover a global footprint, working across multiple industries including, but not limited to, Financial Services, Climate & Sustainability, Energy, Retail, and Transportation.

We believe in the power of diverse perspectives and collaborative teams to drive innovation. Our team comes from a wide range of backgrounds and experiences, and we embrace the unique skills and insights they bring to our work. At Oliver Wyman and within DNA, we are proud of the values we uphold that guide us every day in how we work and collaborate. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive and reach their full potential.




What You Will Do




As a member of Oliver Wyman’s Data & Analytics team, you will collaborate with colleagues and clients at all levels from your very first day, helping clients solve their most pressing challenges. Our DNA team is committed to developing tailored solutions for clients around the globe, including designing potential solutions for analytical challenges, implementing various prototypes while also assessing their effectiveness, and engaging in discussions with clients and colleagues to share ideas. Your contributions will be invaluable to delivering impactful results for our clients.

Notable projects include:

Developing an NLP-based machine learning toolkit to predict credit rating downgrades using news articles – click here for more information
Modelling portfolio decarbonization strategies leveraging advanced analytics techniques for large European banks
Optimizing and developing a promotional program using data from historical promotions for an Asian health & beauty chain by deploying a promotion analytics toolkit
Validating a customer-facing GenAI chatbot for an American bank
Developing probability of default and loss models in Python for European and UK-based banks
Identifying supply chain risks by combining multiple live data feeds, and developing and applying a bespoke AI based risk methodology – click here for more information
Developing a next best action model to reduce customer churn for a global telecom company




Why Join Us?




Expect a steep learning curve, as no two projects are ever the same. You’ll have the opportunity to travel internationally, gaining invaluable experiences and insights across different cultures and with access to the latest technologies, you’ll constantly expand your toolkit with each new endeavor.

You won’t be alone on this journey; various colleagues will guide and coach you throughout your career. You’ll have a dedicated buddy, a career adviser, and a talent manager to help you navigate your professional path. We also care deeply about sustainable work-life quality, providing you with the flexibility to balance your career aspirations with your personal life.

This role will empower you to embrace your curiosity and step out of your comfort zone. You will have the opportunity to work alongside genuine colleagues who measure success by the lasting impact we create together. If you’re excited by challenges and eager to make a meaningful impact, we look forward to welcoming you aboard!




Who Can Apply?




Bachelor's, Master’s, or PhD in a quantitative discipline from a top academic program (Data Science, Mathematics, Natural Sciences, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, etc.)
Data-driven mindset and proficiency with numbers, paired with the ability to explain sophisticated data science concepts in an understandable manner to clients and colleagues
Ideally, programming skills in Python or R, but more importantly, an eagerness to continuously extend your knowledge of technologies
Strong commitment to teamwork and resilience in a creative and constantly changing environment
Excellent command of German & English (verbal and written)
Interest and experience in financial services and risk management is a plus




How to Apply?




To ensure that we can proceed with your application, we kindly ask you to submit your CV together with all of your academic and practical transcripts. This includes your high school diploma, your Bachelor's (and, if applicable, your Master's) transcripts, along with references from your previous work experiences.

Please be aware that applications with incomplete documents will not be eligible for further consideration in the application process.

If you would like to find out more information about Oliver Wyman, please visit our website or alternatively, apply to attend one of our events, details of which can be found here.​

Oliver Wyman is an equal opportunity employer and a wholly owned subsidiary of Marsh & McLennan Companies. To learn more, please follow us on LinkedIn, Instagram or Twitter. ​ Marsh & McLennan Companies and its Affiliates are EOE Minority/Female/Disability/Vet/Sexual Orientation/ Gender Identity employers.




What to expect during the interviews process?




At Oliver Wyman, we want you to shine in your interview. Our process is designed like our work environment — it’s challenging, exciting, and fun.

With a mix of conversational and case interviews, our approach not only helps us to get to know you better, understanding your strengths and interests, but it also enables you to learn more about our people and our business.

If you want to learn more about consulting interviews and start your preparation, please visit our careers page: https://www.oliverwyman.com/careers/entry-level/interview-preparation.html




Oliver Wyman, a business of Marsh McLennan (NYSE: MMC), is a management consulting firm combining deep industry knowledge with specialized expertise to help clients optimize their business, improve operations and accelerate performance. Marsh McLennan is a global leader in risk, strategy and people, advising clients in 130 countries across four businesses: Marsh, Guy Carpenter, Mercer and Oliver Wyman. With annual revenue of $24 billion and more than 90,000 colleagues, Marsh McLennan helps build the confidence to thrive through the power of perspective. For more information, visit oliverwyman.com, or follow on LinkedIn and X.




Marsh McLennan is committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and flexible work environment. We aim to attract and retain the best people and embrace diversity of age, background, disability, ethnic origin, family duties, gender orientation or expression, marital status, nationality, parental status, personal or social status, political affiliation, race, religion and beliefs, sex/gender, sexual orientation or expression, skin color, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.




Marsh McLennan is committed to hybrid work, which includes the flexibility of working remotely and the collaboration, connections and professional development benefits of working together in the office. All Marsh McLennan colleagues are expected to be in their local office or working onsite with clients at least three days per week. Office-based teams will identify at least one “anchor day” per week on which their full team will be together in person.

With annual revenue of $24 billion and more than 90,000 colleagues, Marsh McLennan helps build the confidence to thrive through the power of perspective.
